sen.j: 京阪神緩行線（けいはんしんかんこうせん）は、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）の大都市近郊区間のアーバンネットワークのうち、東海道本線京都駅～神戸駅 (兵庫県)間と山陽本線神戸～西明石駅間で運行される各駅停車の日本国有鉄道時代からの通称である。
sen.e: Keihannshin Local Line is a common name that has been used since the era of Japan National Railway (JNR) for the local line which runs, as a part of Urban Network of West Japan Railway Company (JR West) in the metropolitan subarban area, between the Kyoto Station and Kobe Station (Hyogo Prefecture) of the Tokaido Main Line as well as between the Kobe Station and Nishi-akashi Station of the Sanyo Main Line

Keihanshin Local Line is a common name that has been used since the era of Japan National Railway (JNR) for the local line running, as a part of Urban Network of West Japan Railway Company (JR West) in the metropolitan suburban area, between the Kyoto Station and Kobe Station (Hyogo Prefecture) of the Tokaido Main Line as well as between the Kobe Station and Nishi-akashi Station of the Sanyo Main Line

sen.j: JR化後この区間はJR京都線およびJR神戸線と呼ばれるようになった（呼び方も参照）。
sen.e: After the launch of JR, these section came to be called the JR Kyoto Line and JR Kobe Line respectively (refer to the naming of lines also)

sen.j: 狭義の区間は上記のとおり京都～西明石間98.7kmであるが、国鉄末期の加古川駅、草津駅 (滋賀県)への延長を皮切りに、現在では野洲駅～加古川間144.7kmが主な運行区間になっている。
sen.e: While the train is operated on the Kyoto-Nisi-Akashi Section of 98.7km in a narrow sense, it is actually operated on the Yasu-Kakogawa section of 144.7km since the section of its operation was extended to the Kakogawa Station and Kusatsu Station in the end of JNR era.

While the train operates on the 98.7km Kyoto-Nisi-Akashi Section in a narrow sense, it is actually operated on the 144.7km Yasu-Kakogawa section since the section of its operation was extended to the Kakogawa Station and Kusatsu Station at the end of the JNR era.

sen.j: 京阪神緩行線の呼称は特に定まった呼び方ではなく、別称として、東海道・山陽緩行線や大阪緩行、本線緩行などの様々な呼び方がある。
sen.e: Keihannshin Local Train is not a fixed name, and there are various other names such as Tokaido- Sanyo Local Train, Osaka Local Train and Honsen Local Train.

sen.e: During the pre-war and for a while after the war, trains correspond to current Special Rapid and Rapid were called "Express" or Special Rapid as abbreviated name.

sen.j: このため、急行に対置する概念としての「各駅停車」として、このような呼び方が当時の関係者内部や鉄道趣味者の間で定着したものと思われる。
sen.e: Under such circumstances, it is thought that railway relevant people and railway maniacs at the time began to use this name, in contraposition to Express, as the one that means "trains stop at every station".

sen.e: After the division and privatization of JNR, however, this name has been seldom used because JR West set the name of "Biwako Line", "JR Kyoto Line" and "JR Kobe Line", and its definition became vague due to the fact that the section of its operation was expanded in the end of JNR era and that direct trains started to run into the Fukuchiyama Line and the JR Tozai Line after the JR Tozai Line came into operation.

sen.j: 321系の投入に伴って、201系が大阪環状線森ノ宮電車区と関西本線（大和路線）奈良電車区に、205系が阪和線日根野電車区に転出した。
sen.e: After 321 series cars were introduced, 201 series cars were shifted to Morinomiya Train Yard of the Osaka Loop Line and Nara Train Yard of the Kansai Main Line (Yamatoji Line), and 205 series cars were shifted to Hineno Train Yard of the Hanwa Line.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: After the 321 series, cars were introduced, 201 series cars were shifted to the Morinomiya Train Yard of the Osaka Loop Line and the Nara Train Yard of the Kansai Main Line (Yamatoji Line), and 205 series cars were shifted to Hineno Train Yard of the Hanwa Line.

After the 321 series, cars were introduced, 201 series cars were shifted to the Morinomiya Train Yard of the Osaka Loop Line and the Nara Train Yard of the Kansai Main Line (Yamatoji Line), and 205 series cars were shifted to Hineno Train Yard of the Hanwa Line.

sen.j: その結果、最高速度が120km/hの207系・321系の両形式に統一された。
sen.e: As a result, 207 series cars and 321 series cars, whose maximum speed is 120km/h, are being used.

sen.j: 京阪神緩行線の歴史は、1934年7月20日の吹田～須磨間の電化開業と同時に、それまで運転されていた国鉄C10形蒸気機関車、国鉄C11形蒸気機関車などが牽引する京阪神間の区間運転列車を置きかえる形で始まった。
sen.e: The history of Keihanshin Local Line dates back to the time when the Suita-Suma section was electrified on July 1934 and then existing local trains that were pulled by JNR steam locomotive C10 type and JNR steam locomotive C11 type were replaced by electric trains.

The history of Keihanshin Local Line dates back to the time when the Suita-Suma section was electrified on July 1934 and the existing local trains pulled by C10 type JNR steam locomotives and C11 type JNR steam locomotives were replaced by electric trains.

The history of Keihanshin Local Line dates back to the time when the Suita-Suma section was electrified on July 20, 1934 and the existing local trains pulled by C10 type JNR steam locomotives and C11 type JNR steam locomotives were replaced by electric trains.

sen.j: 電化区間が吹田～須磨間となったのは現在ではやや中途半端な印象を与えるが、1926年の第52帝国議会で電化計画の協賛を受けた大津駅～明石駅間の一部であった。
sen.e: Electrification of the Suita-Suma section, though it looks like a halfway measure in hindsight, was implemented since this section was a part of the electrification plan of the Otsu Station-Akashi Station section approved by the 52nd Imperial Diet in 1926.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Electrification of the Suita-Suma section, though it looks like a halfway measure in hindsight, was implemented since this section was a part of the electrification plan of the Otsu Station-Akashi Station section approved by the fifty-second Imperial Diet in 1926.

Electrification of the Suita-Suma section, though it looks like a halfway measure in hindsight, was implemented since this section was a part of the electrification plan of the Otsu Station-Akashi Station section approved by the fifty-second Imperial Diet in 1926.

sen.j: また、大阪、神戸両市内の高架工事完成後は、大阪、神戸両駅での折り返しが困難になることから、外延部からの集客を兼ねて同区間で電化を実施した。
sen.e: This section's electrification also aimed to attract passengers from outside of the section because trains cannot turn back at the Osaka and Kobe Station after the track was elevated in Osaka and Kobe.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: This section's electrification also aimed to attract passengers from outside of the section because trains could not turn back at Osaka and Kobe Stations after the track was elevated in Osaka and Kobe.

This section's electrification also aimed to attract passengers from outside of the section because trains could not turn back at Osaka and Kobe Stations after the track was elevated in Osaka and Kobe.

sen.j: このとき、須磨～明石間でも電化工事を実施していたが、完成が吹田～須磨間の電化開業に間に合わなかったことから、電車に接続する形でガソリンカーを運転した。
sen.e: Electrification work was also underway on the Suma-Akashi section at that time, but its completion couldn't keep up with that of the Suita-Suma section and gasoline cars were operated on this section.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Electrification work was also underway on the Suma-Akashi section at that time, but its completion couldn't keep up with that of the Suita-Suma section and gasoline powered trains were operated on this section.

Electrification work was also underway on the Suma-Akashi section at that time, but its completion couldn't keep up with that of the Suita-Suma section and gasoline powered trains were operated on this section.

sen.j: 2ヵ月後の9月20日には明石まで電化区間が延長され、緩行は吹田～明石間の運転となって、ガソリンカーを置きかえた。
sen.e: On September 20, two months later, the track was electrified up to Akashi, and local trains began to run on the Suita-Akashi section instead of gasoline cars.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: On September twenty, two months later, the track was electrified up to Akashi, and local trains began to run on the Suita-Akashi section instead of gasoline powered trains.
On September 20, two months later, the track was electrified up to Akashi, and local trains began to run on the Suita-Akashi section instead of gasoline powered trains.

sen.j: 電化と同時に宮原総合運転所に投入された42系電車は、緩行用としてはモハ43（モハ42）-クロハ59の2連を基本編成とした。
sen.e: 42 type electric cars were introduced at Miyahara Integrated Operation Center when the electrification was completed, and local trains were basically made up of two cars, Moha 43 (Moha 42) and Kuroha 59.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Model fourty-two type electric trains were introduced at Miyahara Integrated Operation Center when electrification was completed, and local trains were basically made up of two types, Moha fourty-three (Moha fourty-two) and Kuroha fifty-nine.

Model 42 type electric trains were introduced at Miyahara Integrated Operation Center when electrification was completed, and local trains were basically made up of two types, Moha 43 (Moha 42) and Kuroha 59.

sen.j: 閑散時15分間隔、ラッシュ時には上り側にクハ58-モハ43（モハ42）を増結した4連、更にモハ42を増結した5連を10分間隔で運転した。
sen.e: Trains were operated every 15 minute during the off-hour, and during the rush hour, trains were operated every ten minutes while coupling, in the case of up-trains, additional two or three cars, Kuha 58, Moha 43 (Moha 42) and Moha 42.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Trains ran every 15 minute during the off-hour, and during the rush hour, trains ran every ten minutes while coupling, in the case of up-trains, additional two or three cars, Kuha fifty-eight, Moha fourty-three (Moha fourty-two) and Moha fourty-two.

Trains ran every 15 minute during the off-hour, and during the rush hour, trains ran every ten minutes while coupling, in the case of up-trains, additional two or three cars, Kuha 58, Moha 43e (Moha 42) and Moha 42.

sen.j: 緩行電車でありながら二等車を連結しているのは、関東の京浜東北線同様都市間輸送路線であったことと、まだマイカーが普及していない時代であったことから、電化以前から二等車の需要が高かったことがあげられる。
sen.e: The reason why local trains coupled a second-class car was that the line was, like the Keihin-Tohoku Line in Kanto region, an urban transport line and that a demand for a second-class car was high even before the electrification since the use of private cars was not common.

The reason why local trains coupled to a second-class car was that the line was, like the Keihin-Tohoku Line in Kanto region, an urban transport line and that demand for second-class cars were high even before electrification since the use of private cars were not common.

The reason why local trains coupled to a second-class car was that the line was, like the Keihin-Tohoku Line in Kanto region, an urban transport line and that demand for second-class cars were high even before electrification since the use of private cars were not common.

sen.j: 更に、21世紀初頭の現在では考えにくいことだが、この地域では当時から女子の高等教育機関が多く、女学生の通学に二等車を使うことが多かったことも、二等車連結の理由にあげられている。
sen.e: Another reason was, though it is unbelievable for people living in the beginning of the 21st century, that many female students used a second-class car as many higher education institutes for girls were located in this area,

Another reason was, though it is unbelievable for people living in the beginning of the twenty-first century, that many female students used a second-class car since many higher education institutes for girls were located in this area,

sen.j: 42系電車は当時の省電としては破格の車両であったが、並行するライバル私鉄の車両から比べると、普通車_(鉄道車両)の背ずりが板張りであったりしたことが、やや遜色があったといえる。
sen.e: Although 42 type electric cars were distinguished ones compared with other cars of JNR, they were still a little inferior to those of other competing private railway companies in some respects, such as the wooden back of third-class cars' seats.

Although fourty-two types of electric cars were distinguished ones from other cars of the JNR, they were still a little inferior to those of other competing private railway companies in some respects, they had wooden backs for third-class car seats.

Although 42 types of electric cars were distinguished ones from other cars of the JNR, they were still a little inferior to those of other competing private railway companies in some respects, they had wooden backs for third-class car seats.

sen.j: しかしながら、オーソドックスなデザインは極めて好ましいものがあり、後々まで多くの鉄道愛好者から好かれる車両となった。
sen.e: However, their orthodox design was agreeable and they have become long-lasting favorite cars for many railway maniacs.
However, their orthodox design was agreeable and they have become long-lasting favorite cars for many railway maniacs.
However, their orthodox design was agreeable and they have become long-lasting favorite cars for many railway maniacs.

sen.j: このように、短編成によるフリークエントサービスを行なったのは、電化以前からのサービス向上もさることながら、阪急、阪神といったライバル私鉄を意識した面も多分にある。
sen.e: The reason why JNR operated trains frequently while using a train of a few cars was that it was concerned about the competition with other railway companies like Hankyu Railway and Hanshin Railway, rather than the improvement in service.

The reason why JNR frequently operated trains with fewer cars was because it was concerned about competition with other railway companies like Hankyu Railway and Hanshin Railway, rather than improving service.

The reason why JNR frequently operated trains with fewer cars was because it was concerned about competition with other railway companies like Hankyu Railway and Hanshin Railway, rather than improving service which started before the electrification.

sen.j: しかしながら、電化と同時に六甲道等の新駅を開業し、併せて粘り強くフリークエントサービスを実施したことが、沿線での都市化の推進と乗客の獲得に寄与した。
sen.e: However, as JNR established the Rokkomichi Station at the same time with the electrification and continued frequent operation tenaciously, such efforts led to the urbanization of the area along the line and the increase of passengers.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: However, as JNR established Rokkomichi Station along with electrification and tenaciously continued frequent operation, their effort led to the urbanization of the area along the line and an increase in passengers.

However, as JNR established Rokkomichi Station along with electrification and tenaciously continued frequent operation, their effort led to the urbanization of the area along the line and an increase in passengers.

sen.j: その相乗効果で更に乗客数が増加し、増発、増結につながっていくこととなった。
sen.e: The number of passengers further increased thanks to the synergistic effects of the above, which led to the increase of frequency and number of cars of a train.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: The number of passengers further increased thanks to the synergistic effects of the above, which led to the increase of running frequency and the number of cars of the train.
The number of passengers further increased thanks to the synergistic effects of the above, which led to the increase of running frequency and the number of cars of the train.

sen.j: 緩行の増発・増結は、モハ42・43に余裕があったことからクハ58を増備することで対応した（この頃には三等車の背ずりも布張り）。
sen.e: In order to cope with the increase of frequency and number of cars, cars of Kuha 58 were introduced since there were extra cars of Moha 42 and 43 (third-class cars' back of the seats was upholstered at the time)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: In order to cope with the increase in running frequency and number of cars, cars of Kuha number 58 were introduced since there were extra Moha 42 cars and 43 (third-class cars' backs of the seats were upholstered at the time)

In order to cope with the increase in running frequency and number of cars, cars of Kuha number 58 were introduced since there were extra Moha 42 cars and 43 (third-class cars' backs of the seats were upholstered at the time)

sen.j: 中でも、1936年に登場した、クハ58のラストナンバーであるクハ58025は、42系の側面に半流線型の前面を持つ、極めてスマートな車両であった。
sen.e: Among others, cars of Kuha 58025, the last number of Kuha 58, were very stylish cars whose side of the body was that of 42 type and front was semi-streamline- shaped.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Among others, number Kuha 58025 cars, the last number Kuha 58, were very stylish cars with the side of the body of the 42 type and the front was semi-streamline- shaped.
Among others, number Kuha 58025 cars, which was introduced in 1936, the last number Kuha 58, were very stylish cars with the side of the body of the 42 type and the front was semi-streamline-shaped.

sen.j: その後、1937年10月10日の吹田～京都間の電化を前に、同年8月10日に明石操車場の一角に網干総合車両所明石品質管理センターを開設した。
sen.e: Thereafter, Akashi Quality Control Center, Aboshi Rolling Stock Depo was established at the site of Akashi Train Yard on August 10, 1937 before the Suita-Kyoto section was electrified on October 10 in the same year.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Thereafter, the Akashi Quality Control Center, Aboshi Rolling Stock Depo was established at the site of the Akashi Train Yard on August 10, 1937 before the Suita-Kyoto section was electrified on October 10 during the same year.

Thereafter, the Akashi Quality Control Center, Aboshi Rolling Stock Depo was established at the site of the Akashi Train Yard on August 10, 1937 before the Suita-Kyoto section was electrified on October 10 during the same year.

sen.j: また、その後40年近くにわたって京阪神緩行線を走り続けることとなる、モハ51、クハ68、クロハ69の51系各形式を新製投入した。
sen.e: Also, cars of 51 type, Moha 51, Kuha 68 and Kuroha 69, which continued to run on the Keihanshin Local Line for nearly 40 years since then, were newly introduced.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Also, type 51 cars, Moha 51, Kuha 68 and Kuroha 69, that continued to run on the Keihanshin Local Line for nearly fourty years since then, were newly introduced.
Also, type 51 cars, Moha 51, Kuha 68 and Kuroha 69, that continued to run on the Keihanshin Local Line for nearly forty years since then, were newly introduced.

sen.j: そして、京都までの電化開業後、緩行の運転区間も京都～明石間に延長され、「流電」モハ52や半流43系を主体とした京都～神戸間の急電が現在の新快速・快速の源流になったのと同様、現在まで続く京阪神緩行線の原型がここに確立したのである。
sen.e: When the track was electrified up to Kyoto, local trains started to run between Kyoto and Akashi and the original form of current Keihanshin Local Line was completed, as with express trains running between Kyoto and Kobe, which mainly used cars of "Ryuden" (a streamline-shaped car) Moha 52 and Hanryu (a semi-streamline-shaped car) 43, became the origin of current Special Rapid and Rapid.

When the track was electrified as far as Kyoto, local trains started to run between Kyoto and Akashi and the original form of current Keihanshin Local Line was completed, as with express trains running between Kyoto and Kobe, that mainly used "Ryuden" cars (a streamline-shaped car) Moha 52 and Hanryu (a semi-streamline-shaped car) 43, became the origin of the current Special Rapid and Rapid service.

When the track was electrified as far as Kyoto, local trains started to run between Kyoto and Akashi and the original form of current Keihanshin Local Line was completed, as with express trains running between Kyoto and Kobe, that mainly used 'Ryuden' cars (a streamline-shaped car) Moha 52 and Hanryu (a semi-streamline-shaped car) 43, became the origin of the current Special Rapid and Rapid service.

sen.j: また、同時期に神崎（現在の尼崎）、住吉、鷹取の各駅に折り返し線が設けられ、ラッシュ時の小運転が開始された。
sen.e: Around that time, a track for turning back was set at the stations of Kanzaki (current Amagasaki), Sumiyoshi and Takatori, and short distance operation during the rush hour was launched.
Around that time, a track for turning back was set at the stations of Kanzaki (current Amagasaki), Sumiyoshi and Takatori, and short distance operations during the rush hour was launched.
Around that time, a track for turning back was set at the stations of Kanzaki (current Amagasaki), Sumiyoshi and Takatori, and short distance operations during the rush hour was launched.

sen.j: 京都まで電化開業したときには、すでに大陸での戦火が拡大していた。
sen.e: The battle lines on the continent had already been expanded when the track was electrified up to Kyoto.
The battle lines on the continent had already been expanded when the track was electrified as far as Kyoto.
The battle lines on the continent had already been expanded when the track was electrified as far as Kyoto.

sen.j: この頃から、戦略物資を中心とした統制経済の拡大と奢侈の抑制が図られるようになっていた。
sen.e: Around that time, the government introduced economic control centering on strategic items and advocated to abstain from luxuries.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Around that time, the government introduced economic control centering on strategic items and advocated abstaining from luxuries.

sen.j: 鉄道省もそれに呼応する形で、1938年11月1日から、省電区間での2等車の連結を廃止した。
sen.e: In response to the above, the Ministry of Railway abolished second-class cars in the urban area as of November 1, 1938.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: In response to the above, the Ministry of the Railway abolished second-class cars in the urban area as of November 1, 1938.

sen.j: このときは横須賀線と京阪神間の急電は除外されたから、具体的には京浜線と京阪神緩行線ということになる。
sen.e: While the Yokosuka Line and express trains of Keihanshin (Kyoto, Osaka and Kobe) area were excluded, the Keihin Line and the Keihanshin Local Line became the target.
While the Yokosuka Line and express trains of Keihanshin (Kyoto, Osaka and Kobe) area were excluded, the Keihin Line and the Keihanshin Local Line became the target.
While the Yokosuka Line and express trains of Keihanshin (Kyoto, Osaka and Kobe) area were excluded, the Keihin Line and the Keihanshin Local Line became the target.

sen.j: この時点ではクロハ59、69の両形式は3等代用として使用されていたが、1940年からクロハ59形の3扉化改造（クハ68形に編入）を実施することになった（ただし、急行編成は除く）。
sen.e: Kuroha 59 and 69 were being used as the substitute for third-class cars at the time, but it was decided to modify the cars of Kuroha 59 into the ones with three doors (classified as Kuha 68) from 1940.
Kuroha 59 and 69 were being used as substitutes for third-class cars at the time, but it was decided to modify the Kuroha 59 cars to have three doors (classified as Kuha 68) from 1940.

Kuroha 59 and 69 were being used as substitutes for third-class cars at the time, but it was decided to modify the Kuroha 59 cars to have three doors (classified as Kuha 68) from 1940 (except express trains).

sen.j: また、この時期の変わった話題として次のような事があった。
sen.e: Around that time, there was an episode as shown below.

sen.j: 当時の阪和電気鉄道が車両不足を補うために鉄道省に電車の貸し出しを申請、東京鉄道局からモハ34-クハ38の2連を借りた。
sen.e: Hanwa Electric Railway asked the Ministry of Railway to rent out electric cars in order to make up for the shortage of cars and rented two cars, Moha 34 and Kuha 38, from the Tokyo Railway Bureau.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Hanwa Electric Railway asked the Ministry of the Railway to lease out electric cars to make up for the shortage of cars and they rented two types, Moha 34 and Kuha 38, from the Tokyo Railway Bureau.
Hanwa Electric Railway asked the Ministry of the Railway to lease out electric cars to make up for the shortage of cars and they rented two types, Moha 34 and Kuha 38, from the Tokyo Railway Bureau.

sen.j: ところが、阪和自慢の阪和電気鉄道の車両等に比べるとあまりにもお粗末な内装に、乗客だけでなく会社側からも不満の声が上がった。
sen.e: However, their interior was so shabby compared with the cars of Hanwa Railway, and the voices of dissatisfaction were raised not only by passengers but also by the company.

sen.j: このため、慌ててこの2連を吹田～神崎間の小運転に投入するとともに、阪和にはモハ43-クハ58orクロハ59の2連を貸し出すこととなった。
sen.e: Facing such situation, the ministry hastily rented out another two cars, Moha 43 and Kuha 58 or Kuroha 59, to Hanwa while using the above cars for the short distance operation between Suita and Kanzaki.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: この貸し出しは阪和が南海に合併され、後に国有化されるまで続くこととなる。
sen.e: The above rental continued until Hanwa was merged into Nankai Railway and ultimately nationalized.
The above leasing continued until Hanwa merged into Nankai Railway and was ultimately nationalized.

sen.j: その後、日本は太平洋戦争に突入、1942年11月14日には急電を廃止し、これらの車両も緩行用に投入した。
sen.e: After Japan launched the Pacific War, express trains were abolished on November 14, 1942 and these cars were used for local trains.
After Japan launched the Pacific War, express trains were abolished on November 14, 1942 and these cars were used for local trains.

sen.j: しかしながらモハ52は流線型が災いして（乗務員用のドアがなかったことから）乗務員に嫌われてしまい、編成の中間に組み込まれることとなる。
sen.e: However, cars of Moha 52 were shunned away by crew because of their streamlined-shape (a door for crew was not equipped) and were used in the middle of connected cars.
However, Moha 52 cars were shunned by crew because of their streamlined-shape (a door for crew members was not equipped) and were used in the middle of the connected cars.

sen.j: また、この頃、輸送力増強として大阪環状線のモハ60、クハ55と本線のモハ51、クハ68をトレードして対応していた。
sen.e: At that time, cars of Moha 60 and Kuha 55 of the Osaka Loop Line and those of Moha 51 and Kuha 68 of the Main Line were being exchanged in order to enhance the transport capacity.

sen.j: ついにはこのような小手先の対応ではどちらの需要もまかなうことができなくなってしまった。

sen.j: そこで、当時の担当者が思いついたのが42系を4扉化して城東・西成線のモハ40系の台車と振り替えて城東・西成線に投入、代わりにモハ40系をモハ51として、ロングシートのまま京阪神緩行線に投入する、というものだった。
sen.e: Under such situation, a person in charge proposed to remodel cars of 42 type into cars with four doors, use them for the Joto/Nishinari Line by replacing the truck of cars of Moha 40, change cars of Moha 40 to Moha 51 and use them for the Keihanshin Local Line with bench-seats as they were.

sen.j: この改造は乏しい物資をやりくりしながら積極的に実施され、第1号のモハ43028（後にモハ64028を経て最終はクモハ31002）-クハ55106（元クロハ59022の改造で、とりあえずクハ55の連番として出場、クハ85026を経て最終はクハ79056）が1943年に登場した。

sen.j: その後、多くのモハ43、クハ58が4扉化改造されることとなり、形式もモハ64、クハ85と改められた（モハ42の4扉改造車はモハ42のままモハ32（2代目）に改番）。

sen.j: これらの改造と並行して、既存の車両の座席撤去、ロングシート化も推進され、1942年に横須賀線用（後には宮様の千葉陸軍戦車学校通学に伴い中央・総武緩行線に転属）の2等車として転出したクロハ69001, 002を除くクロハ69、クハ68の全車がクハ55に編入された。
sen.e: Along with the above remodeling, withdrawal of seats or introducing bench-seats for existing cars was implemented, and all cars of Kuroha 69 and Kuha 68 became Kuha 55, except for Kuroha 69001 and 002 that were transferred to the Yokosuka Line for second-class cars (they were later transferred to the Chuo/Sobu Local Line for the purpose of transporting the prince to the Chiba Army Tank School).

sen.j: これらの非常措置と併せて、1943～1944年にはモハ60を増備、1944年1月には6連化を実施して輸送力の強化を図った。
sen.e: Along with these extreme measures, cars of Moha 60 were increased between 1943 and 1944 and the transport capacity was enhanced by introducing six-car trains in January 1944.

sen.j: 直後の1944年4月1日には明石電車区の南側にあった川崎航空機明石工場（現在の川崎重工業明石工場、現在はオートバイの工場だが、当時は陸軍の戦闘機三式戦闘機などを製造していた）への通勤客の輸送手段を確保するため、明石電車区の構内に西明石駅を設置、明石電車区所持者のみの客扱いを開始した（1946年2月1日から一般客の取扱いも開始）。
sen.e: On April 1, 1944, the Nishi-Akashi Station was established inside the site of Akashi Train Depot and started passenger service for season-ticket holders (it started passenger service for people other than season-ticket holders from February 1, 1946) in order to secure the transport of commuters going to Akashi Works of Kawasaki Airplane Manufacturing Company Ltd. located on the south side of Akashi Train Depot (current Akashi Works of Kawasaki Heavy Industries. while it is manufacturing motorcycles at present, it was manufacturing Army Type 3 Fighters at the time).

sen.j: この西明石延長で京阪神緩行線の基本運転区間が確定した。
sen.e: When the line was extended to Nishi-Akashi, the basic section for the operation of Keihanshin Local Line was fixed.

sen.j: しかし、関係者の努力が通用したのもこの段階までだった。
sen.e: Around that time, however, the situation became beyod the efforts of relevant parties.

sen.j: 1945年に入ると、日本本土が激しい空襲に見舞われた。
sen.e: Japan's mainland became the target of air raid in 1945.
Japan's mainland became the target of air raids in 1945.

sen.j: 最初は港湾や軍需工場を狙ったものだったが、京阪神緩行線の沿線でも3月14日の大阪、3月17日の神戸両市の大空襲を皮切りに、B29から空母艦載機に至るまで、継戦能力の破壊と戦意喪失の両面から無差別攻撃が行なわれるようになった。
sen.e: The target of air raid was initially harbors and military works, but air raids were made on the area along the Keihanshin Local Line, including air raid on Osaka on March 14 and on Kobe on March 17, by B29 and other carrier planes with the aim of destroying the ability to continue the war and depriving people of the will to fight.

sen.j: もちろん鉄道もその例外ではなく、いくたびともなく攻撃を受けるようになる。
sen.e: Needless to say, railways were no exception and were attacked many times.

sen.j: 京阪神緩行線の電車の被災は、1945年3月17日の神戸大空襲の際に、神戸駅で滞泊していた電車2両が全焼したのが始まりだった。
sen.e: Among cars of Keihanshin Local Line, two cars deposited at the Kobe Station were burnt down for the first time when Kobe air raid was made on March 17, 1945.

sen.j: その後は、沿線各地の空襲に巻き込まれて被災するようになる。
sen.e: Thereafter, many cars were damaged by the air raid made on the area along the line.

sen.j: 7月7日の川崎航空機工場への空襲では、隣接する明石電車区も大被害を受け、「流電」モハ52系のラストナンバーであるモハ52006が全焼するなどの手痛い打撃を受けた。
sen.e: When the air raid was made on the works of Kawasaki Airplane Company on July 7, adjacent Akashi Train Depot was damaged severely and Moha 52006, which was the last number of "Ryuden" Moha 52, was burnt down.

sen.j: それでも執拗な攻撃は止まず、奇しくも広島に原爆が投下された8月6日には、住吉駅構内で半流モハ43のトップナンバーであるモハ43038ほか4両が被災した。
sen.e: Air raids were made persistently, and on August 6, the day on which an atomic bomb was dropped on Hiroshima, four cars including Moha 52006, which was the top number of Handen Moha 43, were suffered from an air raid at the Sumiyoshi Station.

sen.j: 戦災以外にも、物資不足によって故障車の補修もままならず、車両の稼働率は目に見えて低下していった。
sen.e: Apart from the damage caused by air raids, repair of disabled cars couldn't be done properly due to the shortage of materials and the operation rate of cars dropped sharply.

sen.j: このような状況の中、8月15日の終戦を迎えたのである。
sen.e: The war ended on August 15 under such circumstances,

sen.j: 戦後初期のほうが、戦時下より混乱がひどかった。
sen.e: Situations were much more confused during the initial stage of post-war period than during the wartime.
Situations were even more confused during the initial stage of post-war period than during wartime.
Situations were even more confused during the initial stage of post-war period than during wartime.

sen.j: 軍需工場への通勤はなくなったが、それに代わる多くの買出し者や、帰国した復員者に引揚者たちが電車に殺到した。
sen.e: Although commuters going to military works disappeared, a lot of people rushed to trains including those who were going to buy foods, demobilized soldiers and repatriates.

sen.j: しかし、肝心の電車は空襲による被災と故障車の増加で稼働率は大幅に低下しており、数少ない稼動車も修繕部品の不足から故障車の仲間入りする車両が増加した。
sen.e: On the other hand, operation rate of trains was quite low due to the damage caused by air raids and the increase of disabled cars, and even active cars often became disabled cars because of the shortage of repair parts.

sen.j: このような中でも、連合軍による「白帯車」指定は京阪神緩行線に対しても行なわれ、旧クロハ69、クロハ59出身車を中心に、クハ55が7両白帯車に指定された。
sen.e: The allied forces designated "rail car with white stripe" even under such situations, and among the cars of Keihanshin Local Line, seven cars of Kuha 55, mainly cars of former Kuroha 69 and Kuroha 59, were designated as "rail car with white stripe".

sen.j: ついには、故障車の増加に耐えかねて、京都～高槻間、明石～西明石間で運転本数を削減して予備車を捻出、その間に故障車の修理を急いだ。
sen.e: Under the pressure of increasing number of disabled cars, JNR managed to secure reserve cars by reducing the number of trains running on the Kyoto-Takatsuki section and the Akashi-Nishi-Akashi section and hastened to repair disabled cars.

sen.j: さらに、客車列車の不足を補うため、大阪～姫路間で、国鉄C51形蒸気機関車牽引の42系の故障車ばかり集めた列車を運転した。
sen.e: In order to make up for the shortage of passenger cars, JNR also operated trains made of only disabled cars of 42 type that were pulled by JNR C51 Type Steam Locomotive on the Osaka-Himeji section.

sen.j: このような混乱も1946～1947年の間に63系の投入などで状況は好転の兆しを見せた。

sen.j: 戦時中に撤去された座席の整備や板張り窓の窓ガラス補修、室内灯の整備などが行なわれるようになった。

sen.j: こうして京阪神緩行線は徐々に復興し、ラッシュ時の吹田～神崎、住吉～鷹取間の小運転が復活した。
sen.e: Thus, the Keihanshin Local Line was gradually restored and short distance operation during the rush hour between Suita and Kanzaki as well as between Sumiyoshi and Takatori was resumed.

sen.j: 1949年4月には京阪間に急電が復活、6月には神戸まで完全復活することでようやく緩急あわせてダイヤ面では戦前の状態に復旧した。
sen.e: When the express trains began to run from Kyoto to Osaka April 1949 and to Kobe in June, the timetable of the line, including both express and local trains, returned to the prewar state.

sen.j: ダイヤ面での復興がなると、次に車両面の復興が行なわれることになった。
sen.e: After the timetable was returned to normal, restoration of cars was commenced.

sen.j: 具体的には、戦前同様のクロスシートサービスの提供である。

sen.j: このために、東西を股にかけた大掛かりな車両の転配属が実施された。

sen.j: まずは急電に80系を投入、それまで使用していたモハ52や半流モハ43を阪和線に転出させただけでなく、残りの整備済みの42系（流電や半流モハ43のサハも含む）を横須賀線に転出させ、横須賀線に応援に入っていた63系を他線に振り向けた。
sen.e: Firstly, cars of Moha 52 and Hanryu Moha 43 were transferred to the Hanwa Line when 80 type cars were introduced to express trains, and other 42 type cars (including Ryuden and Saha of Hanryu Moha 43) were transferred to the Yokosuka line while 63 type cars, which had been used for the Yokosuka Line, were transferred to another line.

sen.j: 同じ時期に、関西地区の63系の大半を関東地区に転出させた。

sen.j: これらの車両を元手に、戦前中央線快速に配属され、戦時中にモハ41型への編入改造を受けたモハ51001～51026のうち、戦災廃車の3両を除いた23両全車を京阪神緩行線に転入させた（63系をトレードした大阪環状線・桜島線には、サロハ66改造のサハ78や、クハ47改造のクハ85が転入している）。
sen.e: In exchange, out of 26 cars of Moha 51001-51026 which were used for rapid trains of the Chuo Line in the prewar era and were converted to Moha 41 type during the wartime, 23 cars, except 3 cars that were damaged by air raids, were transferred to the Keihanshin Local Line (Saha 78 cars, converted cars of Saroha 66 cars, and Kuha 85 cars, converted cars of Kuha 85 cars, were introduced to the Osaka Loop Line from which 63 type cars were transferred).

sen.e: Unlike the prewar period, trains made up of only three-door cars equipped with cross-seats were seldom seen on other lines (though a limited number of trains used 72 type cars and Kuha 55 cars) and they were hailed by many railway maniacs as "the Keihanshin Local Line in the Western Japan, the Yokosuka Line in the Eastern Japan".

tit.j: 輸送力増強の影での苦難（1960～1967年）
tit.e: Hardship in the shadow of enhancing transport capacity (1960 - 1967)
Hardships in the shadow of enhancing transport capacity (1960 - 1967)

sen.j: 1950年代も後半に入ると、都市中心部を走る路線だけでなく、京阪神緩行線や横須賀線のような、当時としては中距離路線においても混雑緩和と輸送力の増強が求められるようになった。
sen.e: In the late 1950's, mitigating congestion and enhancing transport capacity were required not only for lines running in the city center but also for middle-distance lines such as the Keihanshin Local Line and the Yokosuka Line.

sen.j: 中でも、横須賀線の輸送力増強は焦眉の急であったが、直流用の新性能近郊型電車の導入までにはまだ時間がかかることから、京阪神緩行線の70系を転属させて投入することにした。
sen.e: As enhancing the transport capacity of the Yokosuka Line was urgently needed in particular, 70 type cars of the Keihanshin Local Line were transferred to it because the development of new suburban car operated on DC was delayed.

sen.j: つまり、中央線快速、山手線の新性能化や、大阪環状線西側の開業用に国鉄101系電車を投入、そこで捻出された国鉄40系電車、72系を京阪神緩行線に転属させることによって70系を捻出して東上させたのである。
sen.e: Concretely speaking, JNR 101 series cars were introduced to Rapid of Chuo Line, the Yamonote Line and the west side of Osaka Loop Line in exchange for JNR 40 series cars and 72 type cars, and the latter were transferred to the Keihanshin Local Line in exchange for 70 types cars.

sen.j: 急速に車両の大型化を進める阪神では、阪神3561・3061形電車特急車を筆頭に阪神3301・3501形電車、阪神7801・7901形電車といった赤胴車が優等列車に充当され、駅間距離の短い普通にはジェットカー（阪神5001形電車、 阪神5101・5201形電車ほか）が続々と投入され、たちまち旧型車を置き換えた。
sen.e: Hanshin Railway, which was rapidly introducing large-size cars, introduced Hanshin 3561/3061 series cars, Hanshin 3301/3501 series cars and red copper cars of Hanshin 7801/7901 series for superior trains and Jet Car (Hanshin 5001 series and Hanshin 5101/5102 series) for local trains and replaced old-model cars by them.

sen.j: 山電も山陽電気鉄道820・850形電車といった元特急車のほか、2扉の特急車と3扉の通勤車が投入された山陽電気鉄道2000系電車、一部木造車が残っていた山陽電気鉄道100形電車を更新した山陽電気鉄道250形電車、山陽電気鉄道270形電車、流線型の山陽電気鉄道200形電車小型車を更新した山陽電気鉄道300形電車、広軌63系として有名な山陽電気鉄道700形電車を更新した山陽電気鉄道2700系電車と700系全金属改造車、そして現在も活躍する山陽電気鉄道3000系電車が運用されていた。

sen.e: Due to the introduction of many 72 type cars that was done ignoring the characteristics of the line, the Keihanshin Local Line lost not only its attraction but also its competitiveness.

sen.e: To make matters worse, the construction work of Kobe Rapid Transit Railway, which connects the Hankyu Kobe Line/Hanshin Main Line with Sanyo Railway, began in 1962.

sen.j: 大鉄局としても手をこまねいていたわけではなく、新潟地区への70系投入についても当初はクモハ54の投入を検討したり（結局モーターの耐寒耐雪改造の関係でモハ70となる）、1964～65年にかけて、横須賀線の国鉄113系電車化の進展に伴って捻出された70系（流電用サハ48の3扉改造のサハ58も含む）を20両前後明石に転入させる（この中には、一度京阪神緩行線から転出した車両や京阪神緩行線唯一の70系300代全金属車であるクハ76305が含まれていた）など、何とかして「3扉クロスシートの京阪神緩行線」を維持しようとした。
sen.e: Under such circumstances, the Osaka Railway Bureau strived to maintain "Keihanshin Local Line using 3-door cars equipped with cross-seats" by the transfer of Kumoha 70 cars to Niigata region (eventually Moha 70 cars were transferred because of the cold resistance/snow resistance of motor) as well as the transfer of 20 cars (including cars that were once transferred from the Keihanshin Local Line and Kuha 76305, a sole all-metal car among cars of 300 series of 70 type) of 70 type to Akashi (including Saha 58 that was converted from Saha 48 for Ryuden into 3-door car).

Under such circumstances, the Osaka Railway Bureau strived to maintain 'Keihanshin Local Line using three-door cars equipped with cross-seats' by the transfer of Kumoha 54 cars to the Niigata region (eventually Moha 70 cars were transferred because of the cold resistance/snow resistance of motor) as well as the transfer of twenty cars (including cars that were once transferred from the Keihanshin Local Line and Kuha 76305, a sole all-metal car among cars of 300 series of type 70) of type 70, which was created along with the development of electric train of JR Suburban Trains Series 113 of Yokosuka Line during 1964 and 65, to Akashi (including Saha 58 that was converted from Saha 48 for Ryuden into a three-door car).

sen.j: しかし、ラッシュ時には300%近い乗車効率に達していたことから超満員の乗客でドアガラスが破損するなど、もはや3扉クロスシート車主体でラッシュ輸送に対応することが困難な情勢になっていた。
sen.e: However, under the situation where the number of passengers reached nearly 300% of train's capacity and the glass of doors was often damaged due to overcrowded passengers, it became impossible to deal with the transport during rush hours by 3-door cars equipped with cross-seats

sen.j: こうしたことから翌年の中央本線瑞浪電化で70系をほとんど根こそぎ大垣運輸区に転出させた一方で（サハ58は岡山に転出）、代わりに京浜東北線から大量の中古72系を受け入れて、昼間時の着席サービスを犠牲にすることでラッシュ時の輸送力増強を図った。
sen.e: Under such circumstances, the Osaka Railway Bureau transferred most of 70 type cars to Ogaki Transportation Depot when the Chuo Main Line was electrified in Mizunami City (Saha 58 cars were transferred to Okayama) while receiving many second-hand 72 type cars from the Keihin-Tohoku Line, and enforced the transport capacity during rush hours at the expense of the number of seats to be provided to passengers during the daytime.

sen.e: Nearly 100 cars of 51 type remained even after that, and 60 cars of 51 type as well as three cars of Moha 70 remained at the time of "Yonsanto" timetable revision made on October 1, 1968.

sen.e: Meanwhile, 113 type surburban cars were introduced in Rapid in 1964 because it became difficult for then existing 80 type cars to cope with the congestion in rush hours and private railway companies introduced new cars for super-express trains in the early 1960's.

sen.j: 103系電車を設計した時には常磐線や京阪神緩行線は想定線区に入っていたが、実際に投入するに際しては何らかの手直し等が必要との認識をしていた。
sen.e: Although the situation of the Joban Line and the Keihanshin Local Line was taken into account in designing 103 type cars, it was generally believed that some amendments might be required when they are actually put in use.

sen.j: それは103系自体が首都圏の通勤路線事情（駅間距離・表定速度・電力事情等）に適した設計となっていたからであった。
sen.e: This is because 103 type cars were designed focusing on the situation of commuting lines in the Tokyo Metropolitan Area (distance between stations, official speed, power condition).

sen.j: 60キロ～80キロ程度でノッチオフすることが前提の形式で、それ以上高速で運転する事はあまり配慮されていなかった。
sen.e: They were designed on the premise that notch- off occurs when trains are running at 60-80km/h and the situation where trains run at the higher speed than that was not taking into account.

sen.e: Therefore, questions were raised whether they were suitable for the Keihanshin Local Line on which such high-speed driving is required, though they were usable.

sen.j: ただ、昭和40年度から2キロ台の駅間距離のある京浜東北線での運用開始に際し、103系のギア比を少し高速よりにセッティングする事や、MT54による通勤電車の可能性を模索した。
sen.e: When they were introduced in 1965 to the Keihin-Tohoku Line, on which distance between stations is longer than 2km, their suitability for commuting car was tested by adjusting gear ratio to a little more high-speed driving or by using MT54.

sen.j: 結局現状の103系と大きな違いは認められなかった事から駅間距離が2キロを超えるような線区でも特に手直しなく103系が使える事が確認できた。
sen.e: As a result, no big differences were found compared with original 103 type cars, and it was confirmed that they were usable, without any amendments, on the line on which distance between stations is longer than 2km.

sen.j: その後昭和41年度より更に駅間距離が長い常磐線に投入される事になるが、先に京浜東北線投入時の研究結果があったために、ディスクブレーキ付きにはしたものの、抜本的な性能に変化はなかった。
sen.e: They were then introduced in 1966 to the Joban Line on which distance between stations is long, but any drastic amendments were made, other than installing disk brake, thanks to the study results obtained when they were introduced to the Keihin-Tohoku Line.

sen.j: 大鉄局では昭和30年代に京都－神戸間の近距離快速電車の増発が目的で、低性能な旧形電車ではなく、快速から逃げ切れる高性能通勤電車を要求した事があった。
sen.e: In 1955, the Osaka Railway Bureau once requested high efficiency cars which could shake off Rapid in order to increase the operation frequency of short-distance rapid trains on the Kyoto-Kobe section.

sen.j: その性能は4扉ロングシート、歯車比が14.82程度、250%乗車時での均衡速度は103キロ程度、平均加速度は1.3m/h/sであった。
sen.e: Their requirements were - 4-door cars with long-seat, gear ratio : about 14.82, normal speed : about 103km when the number of passengers is 250% of capacity, average acceleration : 1.3m/h/s.

sen.j: ラッシュ時の近距離快速電車の編成は15分間隔で6両～10両であり、国鉄本社としては快速増発のために新形式が必要なのであれば、増発せずに増結すれば良いとの結論を出している。
sen.e: Although the Bureau intended to operate short-distance rapid trains made up of six to ten cars every 15 minutes, JNR Head Office concluded that if the Bureau needed new-type cars in order to increase the operation frequency of rapid trains, it should increase the number of cars per a train instead of increasing the operation frequency.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Although the Bureau intended to operate short-distance rapid trains made up of six to ten cars every fifteen minutes, JNR Head Office concluded that if the Bureau needed new-type cars in order to increase the operation frequency of rapid trains, it should increase the number of cars per train instead of increasing the operation frequency.

sen.e: At that time, both of rapid trains and local trains ran on the inner line even on the quadruple-track section

sen.e: Although the Bureau wanted to operate rapid trains on the outer track during rush hours, it was difficult due to the relation with fright tarins and superior trains as well as the structure of Ashiya and Takatsuki station.

sen.j: 大鉄局としては実質複線区間で快速と緩行の同時運転をする必要がある以上、快速なみの高速性能を有して待避駅間を逃げ切れる高性能緩行電車を要求せざるを得なかった。
sen.e: Under such circumstaces, the Bureau had no choice but to operate high effeiciency local trains which could shake off rapid trains between the stations where they wait for the passing of rapid trains.

Under such circumstances, the Bureau had no choice but to operate high efficiency local trains which could shake off rapid trains between the stations where they wait for the passing of rapid trains.

sen.j: 1964年当時の大鉄局の認識も、内側線だけでのラッシュ輸送は飽和状態で、103系のような高加速車ではなく、中速での高速性能を加味したような形式を求めてはいたが、線路使用状況の変化によっては高性能緩行電車でなく103系のような在来型も適するとしている。
sen.e: In 1964, the Osaka Railway Bureau acknowledged that, depending on busy conditions of the track, conventional types of train like 103 type may be used instead of high efficiency local trains, though transport during rush hours using inner tracks only had become saturated and was requiring a new type medium speed train coupled with higher speed capability, other than highly-accelerating trains like 103 type cars.

In 1964, the Osaka Railway Bureau acknowledged that, depending upon busy conditions of the track, conventional types of train like type 103 may be used instead of high efficiency local trains, though transport during rush hours using inner tracks only had become saturated and was requiring a new type medium speed train coupled with higher speed capabilities, other than highly-accelerating trains like type 103.

In 1964, the Osaka Railway Bureau acknowledged that, depending upon busy conditions of the track, conventional types of train like type 103 may be used instead of high efficiency local trains, though transport during rush hours using inner tracks only had become saturated and was requiring a new type medium speed train coupled with higher speed capabilities, other than highly-accelerating trains like type 103.

sen.j: これは、快速の増発用に外側線を使えるような環境になれば、内側の快速を増発しなくても輸送力増強の目的は達せられる。
sen.e: If the circumstance changes to allow use of outer tracks in preparation for increase of Rapid trains, it will be possible to achieve the purpose of augmentation of transportation without increasing frequency of Rapid on inner tracks..
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: If the circumstance change to allow use of outer tracks in preparation for an increase of Rapid trains, it will be possible to achieve the purpose of augmenting transportation without increasing the frequency of Rapid service on the inner tracks..

If the circumstance change to allow use of outer tracks in preparation for an increase of Rapid trains, it will be possible to achieve the purpose of augmenting transportation without increasing the frequency of Rapid service on the inner tracks..

sen.j: したがって、増発に必要な高性能緩行電車を求めなくても良いと言うことになる。
sen.e: Therefore, high efficiency local trains are not necessarily required for increase of frequency of trains.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Therefore, high efficiency local trains are not necessarily required for increasing the frequency of trains.
Therefore, high efficiency local trains are not necessarily required for increasing the frequency of trains.

sen.j: 実際1966年10月からは芦屋・高槻の両駅が外側線からホームに入れる駅構造に変更になった事から、内側線の快速の一部を外側線に移行している。
sen.e: In fact, since October of 1966, a part of Rapid trains running on inner tracks have been transferred to outer tracks after both Ashiya and Takatsuki stations have changed their configurations enabling to lead trains from outer tracks into platform tracks.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: In fact, since October of 1966, some Rapid trains running on the inner tracks have been transferred to the outer tracks after both Ashiya and Takatsuki stations changed their configurations enabling to lead trains from outer tracks onto the platform tracks.

In fact, since October of 1966, some Rapid trains running on the inner tracks have been transferred to the outer tracks after both Ashiya and Takatsuki stations changed their configurations enabling to lead trains from outer tracks onto the platform tracks.

sen.j: したがって、大鉄局の求める高性能緩行電車の必要性は、この段階で不要になったと言える。
sen.e: Accordingly, it became unnecessary, at this stage, to additionally operate high speed local trains required by Osaka Railway Bureau.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Accordingly, it became unnecessary, at this stage, to additionally operate high speed local trains required by the Osaka Railway Bureau.
Accordingly, it became unnecessary, at this stage, to additionally operate high speed local trains required by the Osaka Railway Bureau.

sen.j: 1968年（昭和43年）4月7日にはライバルの神戸高速鉄道が開通した。
sen.e: On April 7, 1968, its competitor company Kobe Rapid Transit Railway Co., Ltd. launched operations.
On April 7, 1968, its competitor, Kobe Rapid Transit Railway Co., Ltd., launched operations.
On April 7, 1968, its competitor, Kobe Rapid Transit Railway Co., Ltd., launched operations.

sen.j: 対抗策として快速の113系化が1967年に完了しており、1968年10月1日の「ヨンサントオ」ダイヤ改正で従来の快速20分、普通10分ヘッド基準のダイヤから、現在と同様の15分ヘッドのダイヤとなった。
sen.e: As a counterplan, it completed remodeling of Rapid trains to 113 type cars in 1967, and revised its timetable from then-current 20-minute intervals for Rapid and 10-minute intervals for local trains to the current 15-minute intervals for all trains, at "Yonsanto " (literally, "4-3-10") timetable revision on October 1, 1968.

As a counterplan, it completed the remodeling of Rapid trains to type 113 cars in 1967, and revised its timetable from then-current twenty-minute intervals for Rapid and ten-minute intervals for local trains to the current fifteen-minute intervals for all trains, at "Yonsanto " (literally, "four-three-ten") timetable revision on October 1, 1968.

As a counterplan, it completed the remodeling of Rapid trains to type 113 cars in 1967, and revised its timetable from then-current twenty-minute intervals for Rapid and ten-minute intervals for local trains to the current fifteen-minute intervals for all trains, at 'Yonsanto' (literally, 'four-three-ten') timetable revision on October 1, 1968.

sen.j: この段階で、快速と緩行の間に性能、サービスの両面から大きな差が開いてしまったことから、緩行への新車投入が急がれることとなった。
sen.e: At this stage, the difference between Rapid and local trains in both performance and services became greater, necessitating sooner introduction of new cars for local trains.
At this stage, the difference between Rapid and local trains in both performance and services became greater, necessitating sooner introduction of new cars for local trains.
At this stage, the difference between Rapid and local trains in both performance and services became greater, necessitating sooner introduction of new cars for local trains.

sen.j: 関西支社、大鉄局双方とも本社に対して以前から緩行への新車の早期投入を要請していた。
sen.e: Both Kansai branch office and Osaka Railway Bureau have been requesting the head office to introduce new cars as soon as possible.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Both the Kansai branch office and the Osaka Railway Bureau have been requesting the head office to introduce new cars as soon as possible.
Both the Kansai branch office and the Osaka Railway Bureau have been requesting the head office to introduce new cars as soon as possible.

sen.j: しかし、爆発的な通勤需要の伸びを見せる首都圏への新車投入が優先された。
sen.e: But, the new cars were preferentially directed to the metropolitan area where explosive demands for commuter trains are seen.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: But, the new cars were preferentially directed to the metropolitan area where explosive demands for commuter trains are seen.

sen.j: その結果、京阪神緩行線への新車投入は待ちぼうけを食らい続け、新形式の導入を待っていたら1970年の大阪万博開催に間に合わない状況になってしまった。
sen.e: Consequently, Keihanshin Local Train was continuously forced to wait for introduction of new cars, until it would become too late for Expo'70 in 1970 to further wait for new-type cars.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Consequently, the Keihanshin Local Train was continuously forced to wait for the introduction of new cars, until it would become too late for Expo'70 in 1970.

sen.j: 万博開催までには新車を投入して欲しいという大鉄局の思いが103系の導入につながったのである。
sen.e: The strong desire of Osaka Railway Burear to have new cars before Expo'70 could lead to introduction of 103-type cars to Keihanshin Local Train.
The strong desire of the Osaka Railway Bureau to have new cars before Expo'70 could have led to the introduction of type 103 cars to Keihanshin Local Train.

sen.j: 実際、103系もこの頃には常磐線（現在の常磐快速線）や阪和線快速といった駅間距離も長く高速性能を要求される線区にも投入されていた。
sen.e: In fact, 103-type cars were already running at that time on Joban Line (current Joban Rapid Line) and Hanwa Line Rapid where distances between stations are long and high-speed performance is required.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: このことから、京阪神緩行線に導入しても充分対応できると判断されたのである。
sen.e: Accordingly, the same 103-type cars were judged to be able to sufficiently cope with the demand of Keihanshin Local Line.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Accordingly, the same type 103 cars were judged to be able to sufficiently cope with the demand of the Keihanshin Local Line.
Accordingly, the same type 103 cars were judged to be able to sufficiently cope with the demand of the Keihanshin Local Line.

sen.j: こうして、1969年8月8日から明石に103系の新製投入が始まった。
sen.e: Thus, operation of 103-type cars started at Akashi in August 8, 1969.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Thus, the operation of type 103 cars started at Akashi on August 8, 1969.

sen.j: そして、翌年2月までに15編成105両が勢揃いして万博輸送に当たることとなった。
sen.e: And, by February of the next year, 15 train sets or 105 cars in total were set ready for operation during Expo'70

sen.e: And, by February of the following year, fifteen trains or 105 cars in total were set ready for operation during Expo'70

sen.j: ところが、京阪神緩行線に投入された103系は、低速域での加減速は確かに51、70、72系より改善されたものの、60km/h以上の加速は全く伸びない、70km/h以上になるとモーターの冷却ファンが凄まじい騒音をまき散らしていた。
sen.e: However, this series of 103-type cars introduced to Keihanshin Local Line was found incapable of increasing acceleration power at the speed over 60km/h, causing the cooling fans of motor to make tremendous sounds at the speed higher than 70km/h, though this series of 103-type cars were certainly improved in acceleration and deceleration capability within the range of lower speed if compared with the series 51, 70 and 72.
sen.cmt: 「103系」は、用語の統一では"JR/JNR Commuter Trains Series 103"となっておりますが、ここでは"103-type cars"という表現を使用しています。
sen.e: However, this series of type 103 cars introduced to Keihanshin Local Line was found incapable of increasing acceleration power at the speed over sixty kilometers per hour, causing the cooling fans of motor to make a tremendous sound at speeds higher than seventy kilometers per hour, though this series of type 103 cars was certainly improved with regard to acceleration and deceleration capabilities within the range of lower speed if compared with series 51, 70, and 72.

However, this series of type 103 cars introduced to Keihanshin Local Line was found incapable of increasing acceleration power at the speed over sixty kilometers per hour, causing the cooling fans of motor to make a tremendous sound at speeds higher than seventy kilometers per hour, though this series of type 103 cars was certainly improved with regard to acceleration and deceleration capabilities within the range of lower speed if compared with series 51, 70, and 72.

sen.j: 新形電車なので、最高速度を100km/hまで取る事ができたが、最高速度は実用限界とも言える95km/hで旧形電車の90km/hに対して性能面ではアップした。
sen.e: Although the theoretical maximum speed was set at 100km/h as a new type car, its practical highest speed was limited to 95km/h, which was certainly better than 90km/h of conventional series.

Although the theoretical maximum speed was set at 100km/h for a new type car, its practical highest speed was limited to ninety-five km/h, which was certainly better than ninety km/h of conventional series.

Although the theoretical maximum speed was set at 100 km/h for a new type car, its practical highest speed was limited to ninety-five km/h, which was certainly better than ninety km/h of conventional series.

sen.j: 電気ブレーキも使用できる事から制動距離も旧形に対しては有利であった。
sen.e: As electrical brakes can be used, its braking distance was also improved from the conventional type car.
As electrical brakes can be used, braking distance was also improved from the conventional type car.
As electrical brakes can be used, braking distance was also improved from the conventional type car.

sen.j: 万博終了後の1970年10月ダイヤ改正で新快速が誕生したが、既存のダイヤの隙間に新快速を増発したため、芦屋、新大阪、高槻で緩行が新快速、快速を連続待避するダイヤとなった。
sen.e: According to the new timetable revised in October of 1970, just after Expo'70 was finished, newly born Special Rapid trains were put in operation interspacing then current timetable, so that some local trains were forced to shunt at Asiya, Shin-Osaka, Takatsuki to let both New Rapid and Rapid trains pass.

According to the new timetable revised in October of 1970, just after Expo'70, newly born Special Rapid trains were put into operation interspacing the then current timetable, so that some local trains were forced to shunt at Asiya, Shin-Osaka, Takatsuki to let both the New Rapid and Rapid trains to pass.

According to the new timetable revised in October of 1970, just after Expo'70, newly born Special Rapid trains were put into operation interspacing the then current timetable, so that some local trains were forced to shunt at Ashiya, Shin-Osaka, Takatsuki to let both the New Rapid and Rapid trains to pass.

sen.j: なお、103系投入によって51系が飯田線や身延線、赤穂線などに転属したほか、72系が首都圏の周辺線区や阪和線などに転属した。
sen.e: By introduction of series 103 at Keihanshin Local Line, 51-type cars were tansferred to Iida Line, Minobu Line, Ako Line and other lines, as well as 72-type cars to the lines at metropolitan rings and Hanwa Line.

sen.j: そして1971年の初頭には最後まで残ったモハ70が3両、仙石線に転属して、51系より先に70系が京阪神緩行線から姿を消した。
sen.e: And, at the beginning of 1971, when the last remaining three cars of Series MoHa-70 were transferred to Senseki Line, the Series 70 has dissapeared from Keihan Local Line in advance of the Series 70.

sen.j: 1972年2～3月にかけて、ヘッドライトのシールドビーム2灯化と側窓のユニットサッシ化が図られた1次改良車を15編成+予備4連×1本（計109両）を新製し、明石に投入した。
sen.e: From February to March, 1972, the first improved car with two sealed-beam head lamps per each and with unitized side windows was made and put in production, out of which total 105 new cars consisting of fifteen train sets plus one spare set of four cars were put in operation at Akasi Train Depot.
sen.cmt: 「シールドビーム」は用語統一では"shield beam lamp"となっていますが、"sealed beam lamp"が正しい。

sen.j: この一次改良車は京阪神緩行線のほかは常磐快速線（松戸車両センター）に投入された。
sen.e: Beside Keihanshin local line, this series of improved cars was also delivered for services at Joban Kaisoku Line (Joban Rapid Line) (Matsudo Train Center)
Besides the Keihanshin local line, this series of improved cars was also delivered for service on the Joban Kaisoku Line (Joban Rapid Line) (Matsudo Train Center)

sen.j: この1次改良車の投入によって昼間時の103系化が達成された。
sen.e: By introduction of these improved cars, most of commuter trains operating during daytime were changed to the series of 103-type cars.

sen.j: 山陽新幹線岡山駅延長による1972年（昭和47年）3月15日のダイヤ改正（「1972年3月15日国鉄ダイヤ改正」）で新快速が15分ヘッド化されたのと同時に、京阪神緩行線のダイヤは大きく変更されてしまった。
sen.e: In accordance with JNR's timetable revision of March 15, 1972, which was made in the wake of extension of Sanyo Shinkansen line to Okayama Station, Special Rapid trains became operated at intervals of fifteen minutes while the timetable of Keihanshin Local Line was drastically altered.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

In accordance with JNR's revision timetable of March 15, 1972, made in the wake of the extension of Sanyo Shinkansen line to Okayama Station, Special Rapid trains ran at intervals of fifteen minutes while the timetable for the Keihanshin Local Line was drastically altered.

sen.j: 特急以上の速度で15分間隔で走る新快速から逃げ切るには線区最高速度90キロの旧形では不可能であった。
sen.e: Conventional type cars with maximum speed of 90km/h were unable to get clear off Special Rapid trains that were running faster than Limited Express trains at intervals of fifteen minutes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Conventional type cars with a maximum speed of ninety km/h were unable to get clear of Special Rapid trains that were running faster than Limited Express trains at intervals of fifteen minutes.

sen.j: 昼間の全103系化がなされた事でようやく実現したのである。
sen.e: Operation of Special Rapid trains at intervals of fifteen minutes became possible only after adoption of 103-type cars for whole daytime operations.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Operation of Special Rapid trains at intervals of fifteen minutes became possible only after the adoption of type 103 cars for daytime operations.

sen.j: それでも新快速運転中の京都～西明石間の直通運転は不可能となってしまった。
sen.e: Nevertheless, it has become impossible to run through trains between Kyoto and Nishi-Akashi stations.

sen.e: Nevertheless, it has become impossible to run trains between Kyoto and Nishi-Akashi stations.

sen.j: そこで、京都～甲子園口間、吹田～西明石間の2系統に分割された。
sen.e: Accordingly, an operation of local trains between Kyoto and Nishi-Akashi stations was divided into two lines, one between Kyoto and Koshien-guchi stations and another between Suita and Nishi-Akashi stations.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: そのほか、新快速運転時は高槻、芦屋の両駅で新快速、快速を連続待避するほか、須磨で新快速を待避するダイヤとなってしまった。
sen.e: In addition, local trains had no choice but to shunt at Takatsuki and Ashiya stations to pass both Special Rapid and Rapid trains back-to-back, and at Suma station to pass a Special Rapid train.

sen.j: このダイヤ体制はその後、1985年（昭和60年）3月13日まで13年続いた。
sen.e: The frame of this timetable continued for thirteen years until March 13, 1985.
The frame of this timetable continued for thirteen years until March 13, 1985.

sen.j: ただし、実用限界の95km/h以上の最高速度を要求された103系は、電気ブレーキ時の衝動などのトラブルが相次ぐ事になるが、それらも逐次問題点が明らかにされて解決されていく。
sen.e: However, this series of 103-type car was consistently required to operate at higher speed than the practical maximum speed of 95km/h, which had accordingly caused a spate of troubles including shocks from electric braking system, each problem of which was subsequently cleared of and solved one by one.

However, this series of type 103 car was consistently required to operate at higher speeds than the practical maximum speed of ninety-five km/h, which had caused a spate of troubles including shocks from the electric braking system, each problem of which was subsequently cleared and solved one by one.

sen.j: しかし緩行運転を2系統に分割したとはいえ、内側線は外側線と同じ閉塞割りであり貨物列車のブレーキ力を想定した信号配置であった事から、すぐに後続の列車に制限信号を与える結果となった。
sen.e: Although the operation of local trains was divided into two lines, the same blocking syetem was assigned to both inner and outer tracks, and the traffic lights, installed at a distance designed with the assumption of braking power of freight trains, gave immediate signals to restrict the speed of following trains.

Although the operation of local trains was divided into two lines, the same blocking system was assigned to both inner and outer tracks, and the traffic lights, installed at a distance designed with the assumption of braking power of freight trains, gave immediate signals to restrict the speed of the following trains.

Although the operation of local trains was divided into two lines, the same blocking system was assigned to both inner and outer tracks, and the traffic lights, installed at a distance designed with the assumption of braking power of freight trains, gave immediate signals to restrict the speed of the following trains.

sen.j: 15分サイクルに新快速・快速・緩行2本が走るという事は平均3分45秒間隔で電車が走る事になるが、その運転間隔をスムーズに運転するだけの閉塞割りでは無かった。
sen.e: The blocking system was, however, not suitable to assure smooth operation of one Special Rapid, one Rapid and two local trains every fifteen minutes in a cycle, which meant each train was running at intervals of average three minutes and forty-five seconds.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The blocking system was, however, not suitable to assure smooth operation of one Special Rapid train, one Rapid train and two local trains every fifteen minutes in a cycle, which meant each train was running at intervals of an average of three minutes and forty-five seconds.

The blocking system was, however, not suitable to assure smooth operation of one Special Rapid train, one Rapid train and two local trains every fifteen minutes in a cycle, which meant each train was running at intervals of an average of three minutes and forty-five seconds.

sen.j: この点もあり、新快速の大阪－三ノ宮間では改正前の23分20秒から10秒増え23分30秒運転となっていた。
sen.e: Accordingly, a new interval of Special Rapid trains between Osaka and Sannomiya became twenty-three minutes and thirty seconds, ten-minutes more than previous twenty three minutes and twenty seconds before the timetable revision.

Accordingly, a new interval for Special Rapid trains between Osaka and Sannomiya became twenty-three minutes and thirty seconds, ten-minutes more than previous twenty three minutes and twenty seconds before the timetable revision.

sen.j: この時期になると、国鉄、私鉄を問わず、通勤電車にも冷房車が導入されるようになっていた。
sen.e: Around that time, both JNR and private railroads began operation of air-conditioned cars for commuter trains.

sen.e: After 1970, JNR started remodelling of Rapid trains of 113 series to be equipped with air-conditioning system, beside Special Rapid trains using JNR electric cars converted from 153 series of the Express "Marine Liner" and "the history of superior trains on Sanyo Main Line"

sen.j: そんな中で緩行の冷房化が行われることとなり、山手線、中央線快速、大阪環状線に続く4番手として、1974年1～3月に京阪神緩行線に新製冷房車が11編成77両投入されることとなった。
sen.e: Under such circumstances, local trains were also planned to be equipped with air-conditioning system, including Yamanote Line, Chuo Line Rapid service and Osaka Loop Line, followed by Keihanshin Local Line as the fourth with 11 train sets consisting of 77 newly built air-conditioned cars from January to March of 1974.

Under such circumstances, local trains were alsoequipped with air-conditioning, including the Yamanote Line, Chuo Line Rapid service and the Osaka Loop Line, followed by Keihanshin Local Line as the fourth with eleven trains consisting of seventy-seven newly built air-conditioned cars from January to March of 1974.

sen.j: このときから従来のように編成単位で投入するのではなく、東京向けのATC準備工事対応の高運転台制御車と京阪神緩行線向け中間車を新製、現地で制御車を差し替えて京阪神緩行線に投入するという手法を取るようになった。
sen.e: From that time, JNR began to take a new method to renew a trailer car on site instead of replacing a whole train set, when they started manufacturing new trailer cars with high-positioned control cab, destined for Tokyo area under preparatory works for ATC, as well as middle cars destined for Keihanshin Local Line.

sen.j: これらを置き換えるため、同年の4～9月にかけて103系を明石に35両（中間車5両×7本）、高槻に23両（中間車5両×4本+予備MM1ユニット+予備T1両）を投入した。
sen.e: In order to replace these train series 51 and 72 with the series 103 from April through September of the same year, 1975, 35 cars of 103-type (7 sets of 5 middle cars) and 23 cars of 103-type (4 sets of 5 middle cars, one extra unit of two motor cars and one extra trailer car) were deployed at Akashi and Takatsuki depots respectively.

sen.j: これでもって7連×11本とバラ予備MM1ユニット+T1両（計80両）を編成して、京阪神緩行線の103系化を達成した。
sen.e: Thus, Keihanshin Local Line was completely reorganized with the train series 103, by introducing total 80 cars consisting of eleven sets of 7-car trains, one extra unit of disjoined two motor cars, and one trailer car.

sen.e: Consequently, Keihanshin Local Line's commuter train series 103 totaled 371 cars consisting of 52 sets of trains, 1 extra set of 4-car train, 1 extra unit of disjoined two motor cars and 1 trailer car.

sen.e: But, among the 103-type cars converted at that time, a series of KuHa 103-type cars (103-type commuter trains with a cab-equipped lead coach without driving motor) were not air-conditioned at all, so that they could not be used as they were during the summer season but had to be renovated into air-conditioned cars at Suita and Takatori depots.

sen.e: At the same time, some cars that were not readily remodelled into air-conditioned cars were tentatively equipped only with control switches for air-conditioning, and also one Tc coach was replaced with another one out of air-conditioned trains.

sen.j: このようにして、四苦八苦しながら夏季を乗り切り、9月には新性能化を完了したが、Tc冷房改造の予備車捻出のため、翌年2月末まで暫定運用を組んで対応した。
sen.e: In this way, JNR managed to overcome difficult situations in the summer season until it completed the renovation in September, but JNR was still to operate the trains under tentative timetables until the end of February of the following year in order to reserve an extra Tc equipped with air-conditioning system.

sen.j: こうして、立ち消えになってしまった105系計画ともども旧型車は全車引退した。
sen.e: Thus, the old type cars have all retired from operation, including those once planned as a series 105 that became later dead..

sen.e: Among those retired cars, there had been four cars of old series KuMoHa 51 (train series 51 with a cab-equipped motor coach) which had remained in operation until the last moment before renovation of Keihanshin Local Line, among which KuMoHa 51010, equipped with Garland ventilator, was transferred to Chuo Line, and the other three cars (51028, 51038 and 51056) were remodelled into a new series MoHa 51 (train series 51 with motor coaches).

sen.j: このほか、旧クロハ69のクハ55150代も阪和線に転出した1両を除き全車最終取替えで枕を並べて引退となり、京阪神緩行線の花形らしい最期を遂げた。

sen.j: 103系化後の京阪神緩行線は、1976年8月に高槻バラ予備のT1両を森ノ宮電車区に転属してきた京浜東北線のTc（入線時に冷房改造済み）に差し替えた。

sen.j: 1978年10月のダイヤ改正の際に、新造車と大阪環状線の予備T及び山手線の中古Tcに明石の予備車を活用して7連×2本+予備4両1編成（計18両）を編成、通勤時の輸送力増強を図った。
sen.e: At the time of timetable revision in October, 1978, JNR tried to increase transportation capacity during commuting hours by organizing two sets of 7-car trains with an extra set of 4-car train (total 18 cars), composed of newly built cars plus existing cars such as an extra trailer coach at Osaka Loop Line, an used Tc transferred from Yamanote Line and an extra car at Akashi Depot.

tit.e: Before and after break-up and privatization of JNR:

Before and after the break-up and privatization of JNR (1983 - 1994):

sen.j: 103系化後しばらく平穏だった京阪神緩行線に、13年ぶりの新車として関西初のスカイブルーの国鉄201系電車が1982年12月に高槻に新製配置され、翌年1月には訓練運転を開始して2月21日から営業運転を開始、3月までに10編成が投入された。
sen.e: After thirteen years' period of little change in the situation of Keihanshin Local Line, JNR deployed at Takatsuki Depot in December of 1982 a new JNR electric train series 201 colored in sky-blue for the first time in Kansai region, which began training run in January of the next year and started operation on February 21, introducing ten sets of trains by March of the year.

After a thirteen year period of little change on the Keihanshin Local Line, JNR deployed at Takatsuki Depot in December of 1982 a new JNR electric train series 201 colored sky-blue for the first time in the Kansai region, which began a training run in January of the next year and started operation on February 21, introducing ten trains by March of the year.

After a thirteen year period of little change since the introduction of commuter train series 103 on the Keihanshin Local Line, JNR deployed at Takatsuki Depot in December of 1982 a new JNR electric train series 201 colored sky-blue for the first time in the Kansai region, which began a training run in January of the next year and started operation on February 21, introducing ten trains by March of the year.

sen.j: 201系の投入は1981年の中央線快速（試作車は1979年登場）、1982年の中央・総武緩行線に次いで3路線目だった。
sen.e: This was the third case to introduce electric train series 201after Chuo Line Rapid Services in 1981 (a trial car had already been made in 1979,) and Chuo/Sobu Local Line in 1982.
This was the third introduction of electric train series 201 after the Chuo Line Rapid Services in 1981 (a trial car had already been made in 1979,) and the Chuo/Sobu Local Line in 1982.
This was the third introduction of electric train series 201 after the Chuo Line Rapid Services in 1981 (a trial car had already been made in 1979), and the Chuo/Sobu Local Line in 1982.

sen.j: 103系のときとは打って変わった素早い新車投入であったが、これには片町線、関西線の老朽101系の早期取替えと、他線に比べて低い両線の冷房化率の向上という背景があった。
sen.e: In sharp contrast with the introduction of commuter train series 103 to Keihanshin Local Line, JNR took quick action to introduce new cars to the line against a background of requirements of Katamachi Line and Kansai Line to replace as soon as possible their aging train series 101 and to improve their comparatively lower ratio of air-conditioned cars.

In sharp contrast with the introduction of commuter train series 103 on the Keihanshin Local Line, JNR took quick action to introduce new cars to the line to meet the requirements of the Katamachi Line and Kansai Line to replace, as soon as possible, their aging train series 101 and to improve their comparatively lower ratio of air-conditioned cars.

In sharp contrast with the introduction of commuter train series 103 on the Keihanshin Local Line, JNR took quick action to introduce new cars to the line to meet the requirements of the Katamachi Line and Kansai Line to replace, as soon as possible, their aging train series 101 and to improve their comparatively lower ratio of air-conditioned cars.

sen.j: 中でも関西線の101系は、前年8月の台風10号による王寺駅構内電留線の冠水による101系の大量廃車により、首都圏からこれまた廃車予定車の101系をかき集めて運行していたことから、これらの置換えは緊急の課題となっていたものである。
sen.e: Among all, these replacements were urgently required especially by Kansai Line which was compelled to scrap many 101-type cars due to damages caused by water-covered storage tracks within the enclosure of Oji Station when the typhoon No.10 attacked that area in August of the previous year, though Kansai line managed to operate other scrap-determined 101-type cars collected from other lines in metropolitan area.

These replacements were urgently required especially by the Kansai Line which was compelled to scrap many 101-type cars due to damage caused by water-covered storage tracks within the enclosure of Oji Station when typhoon No.10 attacked that area in August of the previous year, though the Kansai line managed to operate other scrap-determined 101-type cars collected from other lines in metropolitan area.

These replacements were urgently required especially by the Kansai Line which was compelled to scrap many 101-type cars due to damage caused by water-covered storage tracks within the enclosure of Oji Station when typhoon No.10 attacked that area in August of the previous year, though the Kansai line managed to operate other scrap-determined 101-type cars collected from other lines in metropolitan area.

sen.j: このような状況における京阪神緩行線への201系の投入は、片町、関西両線の老朽101系の取替えと冷房化率の向上につながるだけでなく、京阪神緩行線から高速性能のない103系を転出させることでスピードアップを図るという、一石三鳥の効果を狙ったものだった。
sen.e: The introduction of commuter train series 201 into Keihanshin Local Line was effectively linked not only to the replacement of old series 101 at both Katamachi Line and Kansai Line and improvement of the ratio of air-conditioned cars at the same lines, but also to transferring a series of 103-type cars without high-speed capability out of Keihanshin Local Line and also to try to speed up Katamachi and Kansai lines, killing three birds with one stone.
sen.cmt: 「～を転出させることでスピードアップを図る・・・」という原文からは、「京阪神緩行線のスピードアップ」なのか「片町線・関西線のスピードアップ」なのかが、必ずしも明白ではありません。訳では、後者に解釈しています。
sen.e: The introduction of commuter train series 201 on the Keihanshin Local Line was effectively linked not only to the replacement of the old series 101 at both Katamachi and Kansai Lines and improvement of the ratio of air-conditioned cars on the same lines, but also to transferring a series of 103-type cars without high-speed capability off the Keihanshin Local Line and also to try to speed up Katamachi and Kansai lines, killing three birds with one stone.

The introduction of commuter train series 201 on the Keihanshin Local Line was effectively linked not only to the replacement of the old series 101 at both Katamachi and Kansai Lines and improvement of the ratio of air-conditioned cars on the same lines, but also to transferring a series of 103-type cars without high-speed capability off the Keihanshin Local Line and also to try to speed up Katamachi and Kansai lines, killing three birds with one stone.

sen.j: 実際、201系は高速域から回生ブレーキを使えるというやや無理な要望が盛り込まれた車両であったが、搭載されたMT60型モーターが150kWと高出力であり、電機子チョッパ制御装置も将来近郊用に使用することを想定して開発されたものであったために、総体として103系とは比較にならないほど高い高速性能を持っていた。
sen.e: Although a 201-type car was charged with rather difficult challenge to use regenerating brakes in a high-speed range, it had in fact a far higher capacity than 103-type car's, because it was equipped with a high-output (150kW) motor type MT60 and an armature chopper control device that was designed for future suburban trains.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: そのほか、台車も空気ばねでシュリーレンタイプのDT46系台車を装備して、103系のDT33系台車とは雲泥の差の乗り心地（特に高速域）であった。
sen.e: Besides, its bogie was air cushioned schlieren type bogie series DT46, offering an incomparablly comfortable ride to passengers especially in a high-speed range, being so different from a bogie series DT33 for 103-type cars as chalk from cheese.

sen.j: これらのことから、図らずして京阪神緩行線の特色に見事にフィットした車両となった。
sen.e: In this way, a series of 201-type cars happened to fit excellently to the desired features of Keihanshin Local Line.

sen.j: また、乗客からも一目で新車とわかるブラックフェイスと明るい内装は好評を持って迎えられた。
sen.e: They were also welcomed favorably by passengers who appreciated these cars characterized by an apparently recognizable blackface and bright interior finish both featuring a newly built car.

sen.j: それだけでなく、並行私鉄と比べても遜色のない車両であったことから、新快速の117系同様、防戦一方の国鉄のカウンターアタックのシンボルとなった。
sen.e: In addition, JNR boasted that these train series 201, along with Special Rapid series 117, were no longer inferior than the trains of private railways running in parallel, and put them as a symbol of their counter attack to private railways against which JR/JNR had been mostly defensive.

sen.j: このとき置き換えられた103系は、スカイブルーのまま片町、関西両線に投入された。
sen.e: At that time, the train series 103 that had been replaced with the series 201 were transferred to both Katamachi Line and Kansai Line., without changing their color of sky-blue.

sen.j: このほか、余ったT車は阪和線に投入されて快速の8連化に充当された。
sen.e: And the remaining trailer cars were transferred to Hanwa Line and applied to their ongoing plan of 8-car Rapid train series.

sen.j: また、一部の編成は運用ごと明石に転属して、高槻の配置は201系のみとなった。
sen.e: Also, some train sets were transferred to Akashi Depot according to individual operations, leaving Takatsuki Depot with train series 201 only.

sen.j: 201系の第2次投入は1983年6月から9月にかけて実施され、6編成が明石に配属されて103系を捻出し、片町、関西両線の101系を置換えた。
sen.e: For the second time, introduction of train series 201 was implemented from June through September of 1983, when 6 sets of train series 201were deployed at Akashi Depot, discharging 103-type cars which were then transferred to Katamachi Line and Kansai Line to replace their old 101-type cars.

sen.j: このときの103系捻出車は冷房車だけでなく1次改良車の非冷房車も含まれており、冷房改造の上転出したものもあれば、非冷房のまま転出した編成もあった。
sen.e: The 103-type cars then discharged from Keihanshin Local Line included not only air-conditioned cars but also cars of primary improvement without air-conditioning, which were then transferred either after converting into air-conditioned cars or without such conversion.

sen.j: また、余剰のT車は浦和、松戸など首都圏の電車区に移籍している。
sen.e: Extra trailer cars then reserved at Keihanshin Local Line were transferred to such metropolitan train depots as Urawa and Matsudo.

sen.j: 201系の投入ピッチは早く、1983年の12月から1984年3月にかけて第3次投入分として7編成が明石に配属された。
sen.e: As the introduction of train series 201 was carried on at rapid pace, seven sets of the series were deployed at Akashi Depot for the thrid time introduction from December of 1983 through March of 1984.

sen.j: 同年11月からは、窓の2段上昇化やナンバーの転写表記化など、より一層のコストダウンを図った「軽装車」を9編成投入.。
sen.e: From November, 1984, JNR introduced nine sets of "light-duty car" designed to cut further costs by installing two-step upright sliding windows and by adopting transfer printing technology for numbering.

sen.j: こうして、高槻、明石両区合わせて32本、224両の201系が出揃った。
sen.e: Thus, total 32 sets of train series 201, consisting of 224 cars, were eventually assigned to both Takatsuki Depot and Akashi Depot.

sen.j: これによって関西線各停の103系化、片町線の非冷房101系の置換えと余剰T車を活用した7連化を実施した。
sen.e: Through this development, the local trains of Kansai Line were changed to the series 103, and 101-type cars without air-conditioning of Katamachi Line were replaced with the air-conditioned, as well as extra trailer cars of Keihanshin Local Line were transferred to Katamachi Line's to complete their 7-car train series.

sen.j: この時点で201系の割合が過半数に達したことから、1985年3月のダイヤ改正でいよいよ201系の性能を活かしたダイヤを組むことになった。
sen.e: At that point in time, when the train series 201got a majority among the trains of Keihanshin Local Line, JNR decided to take advantages of train series 201 in making a new timetable to be revised in March, 1985.
