sen.j: 朝夕ラッシュ時には運転区間を加古川、草津まで延長したほか、昼間時の普通のうち毎時1本を加古川まで延長した。
sen.e: According to the newly revised timetable, the operating section during rush-hours was extended to Kakogawa at one end and to Kusatsu at another end, as well as one local service in every hour during daytime was extended to Kakogawa.
According to the newly revised timetable, the runs during the rush-hour were extended to Kakogawa at one end and to Kusatsu at the other end, as well as one local service every hour during daytime.
According to the newly revised timetable, the runs during the rush-hour were extended to Kakogawa at one end and to Kusatsu at the other end, as well as one local service every hour during daytime.

sen.j: 昼間時は1972年以来の串刺しダイヤを解消し、高槻～西明石・加古川間の直通運転と吹田～甲子園口間の小運転に分割したが、京都～高槻間は快速を各駅に停車させて、緩行の運転を取りやめた。
sen.e: Through (skewered) operations of a local train practiced during the daytime since 1972 were all abolished and split into two ways of operation, one being a way of direct services between Takatsuki and Nishi-Akashi/Kakogawa and another being a way of shorter distance services between Suita and Koshien-guchi, while local stopping services between Kyoto and Takatsuki were abolished by making Rapid trains stop at each station.

Through (skewered) operations of a local train practiced during the daytime since 1972 were all abolished and split into two ways of operation, one being direct services between Takatsuki and Nishi-Akashi/Kakogawa and another being shorter distance services between Suita and Koshien-guchi, while local stopping services between Kyoto and Takatsuki were abolished by making Rapid trains stop at each station.

Through (skewered) operations of a local train practiced during the daytime since 1972 were all abolished and split into two ways of operation, one being direct services between Takatsuki and Nishi-Akashi/Kakogawa and another being shorter distance services between Suita and Koshien-guchi, while local stopping services between Kyoto and Takatsuki were abolished by making Rapid trains stop at each station.

sen.j: 現行のダイヤでもわかるように、201系であれば加古川～京都間を直通運行しても性能上問題はないのだが、そうするだけの編成数はなく、当時の状況では車両の増備もままならなかったことから、既存の車両だけで対応するにはスクラップ&ampビルドもやむを得なかった。
sen.e: As you may see in the current timetable, train series 201 can be operated directly between Kakogawa and Kyoto without any performance problem, but actual quantity of available 201-type cars at that time was not enough for the Keihanshin Local Line to do so, and since JNR was in a difficult position to increase the required 201-type cars, Keihanshin Local Line was compelled to manage then-existing cars by scrap and build methods.

As seen in the current timetable, train series 201 could operate directly between Kakogawa and Kyoto without any performance problems, but the actual quantity of available type 201cars at that time was not enough for the Keihanshin Local Line to accomplish this schedule, and since JNR was in a difficult position to increase the required type 201 cars, the Keihanshin Local Line was compelled to manage the existing cars by scrap and build methods.

sen.j: 国鉄末期の合理化の波はこれにとどまらず、1986年3月のダイヤ改正の際に、1線区1電車区の方針によって高槻配置の201系全編成が明石に転属し、運用の合理化を図った。
sen.e: Efforts to streamline the end-stage JNR continued until the revision of timetable held in March of 1986 where all train series 201 at Takatsuki Depot were transferred to Akashi Depot to rationalize their operation in accordance with the policy of one line controlled by one depot.

sen.j: 同年の8月には、これまた関西初の205系が4本、スカイブルーの帯を締めて明石に配属された。
sen.e: In August of the same year, 4 sets of train series 205, marked with sky-blue band on each car body, were deployed at Akashi Depot.

sen.j: これに伴い、103系を阪和線と武蔵野線に転属させた。
sen.e: Accordingly, train series 103 were transferred to Hanwa Line and Musashino Line.

sen.j: そのほか、11月の国鉄最後のダイヤ改正の際には201系と組んで緩行の増強を行った。
sen.e: Further, on the occasion of the JNR's last timetable revision held in November, 1986, the newly deployed train series 205, along with existing series 201, contributed to the increase of transportation capacity of Keihanshin Local Line.

sen.j: 新快速が外側線（列車線）を走るようになったことから、余裕のできた内側線の増発分として、吹田～甲子園口間の小運転の運転区間を高槻～神戸間に延長、同時に、芦屋、須磨での新快速の待避がなくなったことからスピードアップを実施して、快速、新快速も併せて現在に至るダイヤの基礎を形成した。
sen.e: While Special Rapid trains were then running on outer tracks (tracks for trains), inner tracks became usable for increased traffic services, such as extension of short distance operation between Suita and Koshien-guchi to longer distance operation between Takatsuki and Kobe, as well as higher speed operation of local trains by eliminating shunting time to pass Special Rapid trains at Ashiya and Suma stations.
sen.cmt: 「列車線」の意味不詳。ここでは、"tracks for trains"と直訳しておきました。
sen.e: While Special Rapid trains were then running on the outer tracks, the inner tracks were used for increased traffic services, such as extensions of short distance operations between Suita and Koshien-guchi to longer distance operations between Takatsuki and Kobe, as well as higher speed operations of local trains became possible by eliminating shunting time to pass Special Rapid trains at Ashiya and Suma stations.

While Special Rapid trains were then running on the outer tracks, the inner tracks were used for increased traffic services, such as extensions of short distance operations between Suita and Koshien-guchi to longer distance operations between Takatsuki and Kobe, as well as higher speed operations of local trains by eliminating shunting time to pass Special Rapid trains at Ashiya and Suma stations, thus founding the basis for present timetable of all trains including Rapid and Special Rapid trains.
sen.cmt: スペース挿入訳漏れ対応しました。

sen.j: 1987年3月31日で国鉄が分割民営化されて翌4月1日からJR各社がスタートした。
sen.e: On March 31, 1987, JNR was divided and privatized into several JR companies each of which started a new operation on the following day, April 1.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On March 31, 1987, JNR was divided and privatized into several JR companies each of which started a new operation on April 1.
On March 31, 1987, JNR was divided and privatized into several JR companies each of which started a new operation on April 1.

sen.j: この時期の京阪神緩行線の動きとしては、1987年から1988年にかけて103系の冷房改造を2本実施した程度である。
sen.e: Around that time, Keihanshin Local Line underwent no significant change but modification of two sets of train series 103 to the air-conditioned from 1987 through 1988.

sen.j: 1989年以降、京阪神緩行線に残留した103系の動きが慌しくなってくる。
sen.e: After 1989, the remaining train series 103 at Keihanshin Local Line became busy in their manipulation.
After 1989, the remaining train series 103 at Keihanshin Local Line became busy in their manipulation.

sen.j: 残留していた非冷房車の編成（全編成が1969年投入の最古参車）のうち、3本を4連化して福知山線に投入して同線の輸送力増強を実施、1本を冷房改造のうえ4連+3連の分割編成に改造して淀川に転出させた。
sen.e: Among the remaining sets of oldest cars without air-conditioning, all of which had been deployed in 1969, three sets were converted to 4-car trains and transferred to Fukuchiyama Line to increase their transportation capacity, and another train set was divided into 4-car trains and 3-car trains after modification of cars into air-conditioned, and transferred to Yodogawa Line.

Among the remaining sets of the oldest cars without air-conditioning, all of which had been deployed in 1969, three sets were converted to four-car trains and transferred to the Fukuchiyama Line to increase their transportation capacity, and another train set was divided into four-car trains and three-car trains after converting the cars into air-conditioned ones, and transferring them to the Yodogawa Line.

Among the remaining sets of the oldest cars without air-conditioning, all of which had been deployed in 1969, three sets were converted to four-car trains and transferred to the Fukuchiyama Line to increase their transportation capacity, and another train set was divided into four-car trains and three-car trains after converting the cars into air-conditioned ones, and transferring them to the Yodogawa Line.

sen.j: 保留車として残存した非冷房の中間車を除くと、この時点で編成単位で残った非冷房車は1編成だけとなった。
sen.e: At that point in time, there remained only one train set without air-condition at Keihanshin Local Line, except their reserved middle cars without air-condition..

sen.j: このようにして、実質的に冷房化率100%となった。
sen.e: Thus, trains of Keihanshin Local Line became virtually fully air-conditioned.

sen.j: この非冷房編成は翌年に阪和線ATS-P化のために日根野配属の非冷房車とトレードされることになった。
sen.e: In the next year, the last remaining set without air-conditioning was exchanged with a set of cars without air-conditioning of Hineno Depot, in the wake of installing ATS-P system at Hanwa Line.

sen.j: このときやってきた編成は京阪神緩行線初の全車中古編成で、MM2ユニットとT、西明石側のTcは山手線からの流れ組、京都側のTcはクハ101改造のクハ103-2052と、見事なまでの中古車揃いだった。
sen.e: At that time, Keihanshin Local Line received for the first time a train set of used cars only, consisting of two MM-units and one Trailer, of which the Tc directed to Nishi-Akashi had been used at Yamanote Line and the Tc directed toward Kyoto was a Kuha 2052-type car converted from original Kuha 101-type.

sen.j: 1991年3月のダイヤ改正では、昼間時の快速の西明石～加古川間15分ヘッド化に伴い、緩行の加古川乗り入れを朝ラッシュ時のみとした。
sen.e: Following the timetable revision made in March, 1991, where an interval of Rapid train services between Nishi-Akashi and Kakogawa during daytime hours was changed to fifteen minutes, the local train services into Kakogawa became limited to rush hours in the morning.

sen.j: 1991年秋には片町線（学研都市線）の207系量産車投入に伴う103系捻出車が転入、件の非冷房編成を置き換えたあ。
sen.e: In autumn of 1991, when mass-produced train series 207 were introduced to Katamachi Line (Gakken-toshi Line), train series 103 were transferred from Katamachi Line to Keihanshin Local Line replacing the latter's last remaining trains without air-conditioning.

sen.j: こうして、京阪神緩行線の冷房化率は名実ともに100%となった。
sen.e: Thus, Keihanshin Local Line converted 100% of their cars into the air-conditioned both in name and reality.
Thus, the Keihanshin Local Line converted 100% of their cars to air-conditioning both in name and reality.

sen.j: 営業運行を外された非冷房編成はしばらく訓練車として使用されたが、後にMM2ユニットはWAU102冷房改造と延命NB工事を実施、TとTcは廃車された。
sen.e: The replaced cars without air-condition were used for a while as instruction cars, but later their two MM units were remodelled to air-conditioned car series WAU102 and underwent life-prolonging NB repairs, while T and Tc cars were abolished.

sen.j: 103系のシャッフルは更に続き、1993年には207系が投入された福知山線から高運転台Tcの編成が転入。
sen.e: Keihanshin Local Line had continuously shuffled their train series 103 until 1993 when a train set of Tc with high-positioned cab was transfered from Fukuchiyama Line where train series 207 were deployed.

sen.j: 中間車を差し替えて先頭車とMMユニットは広島に転属した。
sen.e: The train set of Tc transferred from Fukuchiyama Line was realigned by replacing middle cars and removing a lead car and MM unit to Hiroshima.

sen.j: このようにして、京阪神緩行線における103系の最後の活躍に花を添えた。
sen.e: In that way, train series 103 crowned their last stage at Keihanshin Local Line.

sen.j: そしてついに、1994年3月に207系1000番台を基本6連+付属2連の8連14本112両を高槻（吹田工場高槻派出）に投入、103系を完全に置き換えた。
sen.e: And finally, in March, 1994, train series 103 were completely replaced with 112 cars of train series 207 (with their car numbers of 1000 range) composed of 14 sets of 8-car trains (6-car basic train with adjunctive 2 cars per train) which were deployed at Takatsuki Depot (Suita factory, a satellite of Takatsuki Depot).

sen.j: こうして、1969年以来25年の長きにわたった（1983年の201系投入後は脇役に転じたが）京阪神緩行線103系の歴史にピリオドを打った。
sen.e: Thus, train series 103 closed their long history at Keihanshin Local Line that had lasted for 25 years since 1969, including the period of subordinate roles they played after introduction of train series 201 in 1983.

sen.j: このとき捻出された103系は、岡山、広島、奈良の各区に転出、老朽非冷房の113, 115系を置き換えた。
sen.e: The train series 103 that were then removed from Keihanshin Local Line were transferred to Okayama, Hiroshima and Nara lines to replace their old series 113 and 115 without air-conditioning.

sen.j: また、207系の投入によって、京阪神緩行線初の8連運行が始まったほか、6連運行も久々に復活した。
sen.e: By introduction of train series 207, Keihanshin Local Line could launch operation of 8-car trains together with 6-car train services that were resumed after a long time interval.

sen.j: 同年9月のダイヤ改正では、週休2日制の拡大により、京阪神緩行線にも土曜・休日ダイヤが導入された。
sen.e: By the revision of timetable made in September of the same year, JR started new services on Saturday and holidays at Keihanshin Local Line, in the wake of expansion of five-day week system.

tit.j: アーバンネットワークの中枢として（1995年～）
tit.e: As a center of urban network system (1995-):
As the center of the urban network system (1995-):

sen.j: 1995年1月17日に発生した阪神・淡路大震災では、京阪神緩行線は震源（朝霧駅沖の明石海峡）から武庫川（甲子園口～立花間）まで激甚被災地を貫いて走っていたことから、神戸市内を中心に強烈なダメージを受けた。
sen.e: Keihanshin Local Line, running through the center of the urban site of Kobe City, suffered a great damage from the Great Hanshin-Awaji Earthquake on January 17, 1995, since it ran through the seriously disastered area, from epicenter (in the Akashi Strait off the coast of Asaka Station) to Mukogawa river (between Koshien Station and Tachibana Station.)

The Keihanshin Local Line, running through the center of the urban site of Kobe City, suffered great damage from the Great Hanshin-Awaji Earthquake on January 17, 1995, since it ran through the seriously hit area, from epicenter (in the Akashi Strait off the coast of Asaka Station) to Mukogawa river (between Koshien Station and Tachibana Station.)

The Keihanshin Local Line, running through the center of the urban site of Kobe City, suffered great damage from the Great Hanshin-Awaji Earthquake on January 17, 1995, since it ran through the seriously hit area, from epicenter (in the Akashi Strait off the coast of Asaka Station) to Muko-gawa River (between Koshien Station and Tachibana Station).
sen.cmt: 用語統一ピリオド位置移動

sen.j: 発災時刻が早朝であったことから、車両の面では大きな被害を受けなかったが、鷹取駅東方で地震に遭った201系が1編成、駅南東方で発生した大火災に奇跡的に巻き込まれずに高架線上に残っている姿は、繰り返し新聞やテレビで流された。
sen.e: Because the earthquake occurred in the early morning, most of JNR's coaches staved off big damage, though news papers and TV repeatedly reported a scene of one set of train series 201 left standing on an elevated track, which had encountered the earthquake in the east of Takatori Station but miraculously uninvolved in the nearby disastrous fire in the south-east of the station.

Because the earthquake occurred in the early morning, most JNR's coaches escaped big damage, though news papers and TV repeatedly reported the scene of one set of train series 201 left standing on an elevated track, on the east side of Takatori Station that miraculously avoided a nearby disastrous fire south-east of the station.

Because the earthquake occurred in the early morning, most JNR's coaches escaped big damage, though news papers and TV repeatedly reported the scene of one set of train series 201 left standing on an elevated track, on the east side of Takatori Station that miraculously avoided a nearby disastrous fire south-east of the station.

sen.j: 翌々日に高速神戸～阪神三宮間が復旧した神戸高速・阪神本線と併せて、発災以来約2週間ぶりで乗換えをはさみながらも三宮まで電車で到達することができるようになったのである。
sen.e: Together with Kobe Rapid Transit Railway and Hanshin Main Line, which resumed operation between Kosokukobe and Hanshin-Sannomiya two days later, JNR made it possible, in two weeks after the earthquake, to reach Sannomiya by changing trains.

Together with Kobe Rapid Transit Railway and the Hanshin Main Line, which resumed operations between Kosokukobe and Hanshin-Sannomiya two days later, JNR made it possible, in two weeks after the earthquake, to reach Sannomiya by changing trains.

sen.j: 復旧工事は夜に日を継いで実施され、2月8日には芦屋～住吉間が、2月20日には神戸～灘間が復旧、残るは高架橋が崩壊した六甲道周辺を含む住吉～灘間のみとなった。
sen.e: Restoration works were carried out every day and night until February 8, when the section between Ashiya and Sumiyoshi became restored, and until February 20, when another section between Kobe and Nada became restored, leaving the section between Sumiyoshi and Nada yet to be reconstruct including an elevated bridge that had been destructed in the area of Rokkomichi.

Restoration work was carried out every day and night until February 8, when the section between Ashiya and Sumiyoshi was restored, and until February 20, when another section between Kobe and Nada was restored, leaving the section between Sumiyoshi and Nada yet to be reconstructed including an elevated bridge that had been destroyed in the area of Rokkomichi.

Restoration work was carried out every day and night until February 8, when the section between Ashiya and Sumiyoshi was restored, and until February 20, when another section between Kobe and Nada was restored, leaving the section between Sumiyoshi and Nada yet to be reconstructed including an elevated bridge that had been destroyed in the area of Rokkomichi.

sen.j: 西明石～灘間の復旧に伴い、輸送力増強のために201系の一部編成を8連化し、T車を抜いた編成2本を連結して12連で運行した。
sen.e: In the wake of restoration between Nishi-Akashi and Nada, transportation capacity was increased by arranging a part of train series 201 into 12-car trains made up of two sets of 8-car trains excluding T-coaches.
sen.cmt: 「～を8連化し、T車を抜いた編成2本を連結して12連で運行した」の内容を、「8連化した2本の列車からT車を抜いたものをさらに連結して12連化した列車を運行した」と解釈して訳しました。
sen.e: After restoration between Nishi-Akashi and Nada, transportation capacity was increased by arranging a part of train series 201 into twelve-car trains made up of two sets of eight-car trains excluding the T-coaches.

After restoration between Nishi-Akashi and Nada, transportation capacity was increased by arranging a part of train series 201 into twelve-car trains made up of two sets of eight-car trains excluding the T-coaches.

sen.j: この12両編成は、上りのみ緩行停車の朝霧、舞子、塩屋、鷹取のホームを延伸したため、下りは快速として運行された。
sen.e: 12-car trains were operated as a local up-train making a stop at Asaka, Maiko, Shioya and Takatori stations whose platforms were extended for 12-car trains, but the same down-trains were operated as Rapid.
sen.cmt: 原文の意味がよく理解できません。「12両編成は上り列車のみ緩行運転され、それが停車できるように朝霞、舞子、塩屋、鷹取のホームが延長されたが、下りは快速運行された」という意味に解釈して訳しました。
sen.e: Twelve-car trains were running as a local up-trains making stops at Asaka, Maiko, Shioya, and Takatori stations whose platforms were extended for twelve-car trains, but the same down-trains were operated as Rapid service.

Twelve-car trains were running as a local up-trains making stops at Asaka, Maiko, Shioya, and Takatori stations whose platforms were extended for twelve-car trains, but the same down-trains were operated as Rapid service.

sen.j: この他にも広島や日根野から103系をかき集めて西明石～灘間に投入、車両不足を補った。
sen.e: Furthermore, additional train series 103 were mobilized from Hiroshima and Hineno depots in order to supplement shortage of trains to be operated between Nishi-Akashi and Nada.
Furthermore, additional train series 103 were mobilized from Hiroshima and Hineno depots in order to supplement the shortage of trains between Nishi-Akashi and Nada.
Furthermore, additional train series 103 were mobilized from Hiroshima and Hineno depots in order to supplement the shortage of trains between Nishi-Akashi and Nada.

sen.j: その間にも新長田駅周辺の復旧工事を実施、3月10日にようやく営業を再開した。
sen.e: Meanwhile, restoration of Shinnagata Station and its surrounding area was also implemented to resume its operations on March 10.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Meanwhile, restoration of Shinnagata Station and its surrounding area was also implemented to resume operations on March 10.
Meanwhile, restoration of Shinnagata Station and its surrounding area was also implemented to resume operations on March 10.

sen.j: そして、最終的に4月1日には全線復旧した。
sen.e: And, the whole line was eventually restored on April 1.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: And, the whole line was eventually restored on April 1.
And, the whole line was eventually restored on April 1.

sen.j: 復旧後に201系を元の7連に戻したほか、103系も福知山線に転用するなど、インフラ面も含めて復旧後も復元に向けた整備が続いたのである。
sen.e: Even after completion of the restoration work, further efforts were continued for reintegration to original conditions including infrastructure before the earthquake, such as remodeling of train series 201 from 8-car or 12-car sets to original 7-car train sets as well as transferring of train series 103 to Fukuchiyama Line.

Even after completion of the restoration work, further efforts continued for reintegration to original conditions including the infrastructure before the earthquake, such as remodeling of train series 201 from eight-car or twelve-car sets to original seven-car train sets as well as transferring of train series 103 to the Fukuchiyama Line.

Even after completion of the restoration work, further efforts continued for reintegration to original conditions including the infrastructure before the earthquake, such as remodeling of train series 201 from eight-car or twelve-car sets to original seven-car train sets as well as transferring of train series 103 to the Fukuchiyama Line.

sen.j: 同年9月1日のダイヤ改正で、新幹線利用者の利便性向上のためラッシュ時の福知山線電車を吹田まで延長した。
sen.e: By the timetable revision made on September 1, the same year, train services of Fukuchiyama Line were extended upto Suita in rush hour to improve convenience of passengers of Shinkansen bullet trains.

By the timetable revision made on September 1, the same year, train services of the Fukuchiyama Line were extended to Suita during the rush hour to improve the convenience of passengers on the Shinkansen bullet trains.

By the timetable revision made on September 1, the same year, train services of the Fukuchiyama Line were extended to Suita during the rush hour to improve the convenience of passengers on the Shinkansen bullet trains.

sen.j: また、震災から1年半経過し、神戸市内も徐々に復興の兆しが見え始めた1996年7月20日の改正で、昼間時の神戸止まりを需要の拡大を図るために須磨まで延伸、ちょうど夏の海水浴シーズンであったことから、海水浴客には大いに喜ばれた。
sen.e: On July 20, 1996, about one and half years after the earthquake, when Kobe City began to show signs of gradual restoration, another revision of timetable was made, where train services upto Kobe during the day time were extended upto Suma, which revision, aiming at expansion of demands, was highly welcomed by seagoers then amid the sea-bathing season.
sen.cmt: 原文の「需要の拡大を図るため」は「需要の拡大を期待して」の意味ではないかと思慮しましたが、訳文は原文を直訳してaiming at …としました。
sen.e: On July 20, 1996, about one and half years after the earthquake, when Kobe City began to show signs of gradual restoration, another revision of the timetable was made, where train services to Kobe during the day time were extended to Suma, aiming at expanding demand, was highly welcomed by beach goers amid the sea-bathing season.

On July 20, 1996, about one and half years after the earthquake, when Kobe City began to show signs of gradual restoration, another revision of the timetable was made, where train services to Kobe during the day time were extended to Suma, aiming at expanding demand, was highly welcomed by beach goers amid the sea-bathing season.

sen.j: 1997年3月8日のJR東西線開業に向けて、京阪神緩行線所属の207系の編成替えが、淀川、宮原両区配属の同系も含めて広く実施された。
sen.e: Toward the inauguration of JR Tozai Line on March 8, 1997, reshuffling of train series 207 was widely conducted at Keihanshin Local Line as well as Yodogawa and Miyahara train depots.
Toward the inauguration of JR Tozai Line on March 8, 1997, reshuffling train series 207 was widely conducted on the Keihanshin Local Line as well as Yodogawa and Miyahara train depots.

sen.j: 松井山手における分割併合に配慮して、下り側に付属3連+基本4連の7連に変更され、編成両数は再び7連に統一された。
sen.e: Considerring the fact that every train had to be combined or separated at Matsuiyamate, each train set was again unified to a 7-car train consisting of a basic 4-car train plus an additional 3-car down train.
sen.cmt: 「下り側に付属3連＋基本4連」の意味を次のように解釈して訳しました。つまり、「松井山手駅から出発する下り線は、下り側に連結された付属3連を切り離した残りの4連車で運行し、逆に上り線は下り線側に付属3連を連結した7連車で運行する」と。
sen.e: Considerring the fact that every train had to be combined or separated at Matsuiyamate, each train set was again unified to a seven-car train consisting of a basic four-car train plus an additional three-car down train.

Considering the fact that every train had to be combined or separated at Matsuiyamate, each train set was again unified to a seven-car train consisting of a basic four-car train plus an additional three-car down train.

sen.j: そして、東西線開業を契機に京阪神緩行線のダイヤは大きく変更されることとなった。
sen.e: Keihanshin Local Line took this opportunity of inauguration of Tozai Line to drastically change their current timetable.
The Keihanshin Local Line took the opportunity of the inauguration of the Tozai Line to drastically change their current timetable.
The Keihanshin Local Line took the opportunity of the inauguration of the Tozai Line to drastically change their current timetable.

sen.j: 従来は高槻～須磨・西明石間の通し運行だけだったのが、西明石～松井山手間の東西線直通運用とそれに接続する尼崎～高槻間の区間運行及び須磨～高槻間の通し運行に2分割されたのである。
sen.e: A conventional through operation between Takatsuki and Suma/Nishi-Akashi was divided into two; one being a direct operation from Nishi-Akashi to Matsuiyamate of Tozai Line with its connective service for the section from Amagasaki to Takatsuki, and another one being a through operation between Suma Station and Takatsuki Station.

A conventional through operation between Takatsuki and Suma/Nishi-Akashi was divided into two; one being a direct operation from Nishi-Akashi to Matsuiyamate on the Tozai Line with its connecting service for the section from Amagasaki to Takatsuki, and another being a through operation between Suma Station and Takatsuki Station.

A conventional through operation between Takatsuki and Suma/Nishi-Akashi was divided into two; one being a direct operation from Nishi-Akashi to Matsuiyamate on the Tozai Line with its connecting service for the section from Amagasaki to Takatsuki, and another being a through operation between Suma Station and Takatsuki Station.

sen.j: その後もダイヤの見直しは幾度か繰り返された。

sen.e: According to the timetable revised on September 1, the same year, when rewiring works at Kyoto Station Building and Amagasaki Station were completed, Keihanshin Local Line resumed its daytime services extended upto Kyoto after a long interval of twelve years.

sen.e: Also by the same timetable revision, the starting station of direct train services into Tozai Line was changed to Suma Station.

sen.j: そのほか、JR宝塚線（福知山線）の普通と尼崎～高槻間の区間運転が一体化して、京阪神緩行線の一翼を担うこととなった。
sen.e: In addition, local train services of Takarazuka Line (Fukuchiyama Line) were integrated with the sectional train operations between Amagasaki and Takatsuki, thus participating into the services of Keihanshin Local Line.

In addition, local train services on the Takarazuka Line (Fukuchiyama Line) were integrated with sectional train operations between Amagasaki and Takatsuki, thus participating in the services of the Keihanshin Local Line.

sen.j: この時の運用は京都→西明石→高槻→新三田→京都のローテーションで、この運用が2003年3月のダイヤ改正で京阪神緩行線（京都←→西明石）と京阪神緩行・JR宝塚線（高槻←→新三田）に分割されるまで続くこととなる。
sen.e: At that time, trains were operated in rotation from Kyoto to Nishi-Akashi, to Takatsuki, to Shin-Sanda, and back to Kyoto, until the timetable was revised in March of 2003, whereby said rotation became divided into two lines, namely Keihanshin Local Line (from Kyoto to Nishi-Akashi) and Keihanshin/JR Takarazuka Line (between Takatsuki and Shin-Sanda).

sen.j: また、直通運行が常態化することで福知山線の103系をカナリヤイエローに塗り分ける必要性がなくなった。
sen.e: As direct operations to other lines were normalized, it became unnecessary to repaint 103-type cars of Fukuchiyama Line into canary yellow.

sen.j: 1999～2000年にかけて宮原所属の103系をスカイブルーに塗り替えている。
sen.e: From 1999 through 2000, 103-type cars of Miyahara Depot were repainted into sky blue.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: なお、103系は京都までの乗り入れは復活したものの朝ラッシュ時のみの運行で、尼崎以西には入線していない。
sen.e: Although Keihanshin Local Line resumed services of train series 103 upto Kyoto, their operating time was limited to rush hours only and their operation area did not cover western side beyond Amagasaki.

sen.j: その後、1998年10月のダイヤ改正では、明石海峡大橋の開通と垂水、明石駅周辺の再開発が進んだことから、昼間時の須磨止まりの緩行21往復を西明石まで延伸したほか、朝ラッシュ時の大久保延伸も同時に実施された。
sen.e: Then in October, 1998, when the Akashi-Kaikyo Bridge opened to traffic and the area around Tarumi and Akashi Station underwent redevelopment, twenty-one round trips of local train services upto Suma in the daytime were extended to Nishi-Akashi, together with extention of their rush hour services upto Okubo.

Then in October, 1998, when the Akashi-Kaikyo Bridge opened to traffic and the area around Tarumi and Akashi Station underwent redevelopment, twenty-one round trips of local train services to Suma during the daytime were extended to Nishi-Akashi, together with extention of their rush hour services to Okubo.

Then in October 1998, when the Akashi-Kaikyo Bridge opened to traffic and the area around Tarumi and Akashi Station underwent redevelopment, twenty-one round trips of local train services to Suma during the daytime were extended to Nishi-Akashi, together with extension of their morning rush hour services to Okubo.

sen.j: その後は湖西線方面への運行区間拡大を除くと大きな変化に乏しかった京阪神緩行線である。
sen.e: Since then, no big change happened in operation of Keihanshin Local Line, except expansion of its operational area toward Kosai Line.

sen.j: 2005年12月からJR西日本321系電車の投入が始まって国鉄201系電車・国鉄205系電車の置換えが開始され、すでに205系は全編成28両が阪和線（日根野電車区）に転出した。
sen.e: After December, 2005, JR West began introducing electric train series 321, with which they replaced their train series 201 and 205, including all train sets of twenty-eight cars of 205-type which had already been transferred to Hanwa Line (Hineno Electric Train Depot).

sen.j: そのほか、2006年3月のダイヤ改正で昼間時の京都←→西明石が京都←→須磨に変更されたため須磨折返しが復活した。
sen.e: In addition, by the timetable revision of March, 2006, the daytime operation of their trains between Kyoto and Nishi-Akashi was changed to that between Kyoto and Suma, thus reviving turns of train direction at Suma Station.

sen.j: 321系の投入により、201系は大阪環状線や桜島線用として森ノ宮電車区に8連16編成128両が転属し、また大和路線用に6連16編成96両が奈良電車区に転出した。
sen.e: Along with adoption of train series 321, Keihanshin Local Line shifted their existing sixteen sets of 8-car trains (128 cars in total) to Morinomiya Electric Train Depot for use on Osaka Loop Line and Sakurajima Line, as well as their existing sixteen sets of 6-car trains (96 cars in total) to Nara Electric Train Depot for use on Yamatoji Line.

Along with the adoption of train series 321, the Keihanshin Local Line shifted existing sixteen sets of eight-car trains (128 cars in total) to Morinomiya Electric Train Depot for use on the Osaka Loop Line and Sakurajima Line, as well as their existing sixteen sets of six-car trains (ninety-six cars in total) to Nara Electric Train Depot for use on the Yamatoji Line.

sen.j: その結果2007年3月改正から207系と321系のみで運用されるようになった。

sen.j: 一方車両の高性能化を後押ししたのは新駅の開業である。
sen.e: On the otherhand, technical advancement in performance of electric trains has been encouraged by establishment of new stations.

sen.j: 平行する私鉄に較べ長い駅間であったが、2007年3月には西宮駅 (JR西日本)（西ノ宮から改称）～芦屋間にさくら夙川駅が、2008年3月には山崎駅 (京都府)～高槻間に島本駅が、鷹取駅～須磨間に須磨海浜公園駅が、同年10月には西大路～向日町間に桂川駅 (京都府)がそれぞれ開業した。
sen.e: Since JNR/JR had their stations with longer intervals compared with private railways running in parallel, JR has established in March, 2007, new Sakura-Shukugawa Station in between Nishinomiya Station (JR-West) (renamed from old Nishinomiya) and Ashiya, and in March, 2008, new Shimamoto Station in between Yamazaki Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and Takatsuki, as well as a new station, Katsuragawa Station (Kyoto Prefecture) in between Nishioji and Mukomachi in October, 2008.

sen.j: 京阪神緩行線はこれからも時代にあった変化を重ねながら、アーバンネットワークの中核線区としての役割を担い続けることとなる。
